loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marlene works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. Marlene is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is a 65-year-old divorced woman with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She trades in foods as her only source of income and with the proceeds, she has been able to educate her children and buy land for farming. Price fluctuation and inflation affect the business. Her dream is to diversify and trade in a variety of foods. Joy intends to use the loan to buy millet to sell.

loans.use: to buy millet to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 59-year-old farmer in Kitale county, where he lives with his wife. He has six children who are all adults and have finished schooling. He has been in farming for the past 30 years, producing milk, horticultural and poultry products, which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 61,200 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow and also buy materials for constructing a zero-grazing unit. This will help him to take good care of his dairy cows and also increase production of more milk and thus, make more income to help improve the family’s living standards. He aspires to have doubled his production in the next five years.

High cost of production and low market prices are his major challenges in farming.

He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for financing him with the loan.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and buy materials for constructing a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: Pius is a 31-year-old man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He works as a health information assistant and with his meager salary, he has been able to buy land for farming. The good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University and build rental houses to earn extra income despite inadequate capital to execute these plans. Pius intends to use the loan to construct rental houses.

loans.use: to construct rental houses

loans.name: Asanbek

texts.ru: Асанбек имеет высшее образование по специальности геолог. Ему 51 год, женат и воспитали 4 детей, трое взрослые и обустроены. В течении долгого времени Асанбек работает прорабомв родном селе. Имеет хорошие отзывы от односельчан, Асанбек, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, начал заниматься разведением скота. Начав свой бизнес со стартовой суммой 10,000 сом , Асанбек приложил все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, приносящего на сегодняшний день прибыль в 7,000 сом ежемесячно от перепродажи скота. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асанбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 жеребят. В будущем, Асанбек планирует расширять поголовье скота, с целью повышения доходов от перепродажи скота.
texts.en: Asanbek has a post-secondary education in the field of geology. He is 51 years old, married, and has raised 4 children, 3 of whom are now grown up and established in their own lives. For a long time, he has worked as the supervisor of public works of his hometown. He is well-regarded by his fellow citizens. As a means of supplementing his income, he began raising cattle. He started this business with just 10,000 Kyrgyzstan Som and has worked hard to develop it to the point where it currently brings in a monthly income of 7,000 Som from the sale of cattle. For the further development of his business, Asanbek has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 Som (KGS) to buy two colts. In the future, he plans to expand the number of cattle he has for the purpose of increasing his profit from the sale of cattle.

loans.use: To purchase two horses

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en: Mr. Batbold, 48 years old, lives with his daughter and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. His daughter graduated last year and now teaches elementary classes at school. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for five consecutive years and accumulated a vast amount of experience. His mother gets a pension from the state. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to import goods from Korea. Then he will exchange those import goods for cashmere, which will be sold to customers and facilities in Ulaanbaatar. As a result, he can generate more income for his family. The borrower used our loan two times before and paid each installment on a fixed schedule without delay. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future and wants to help his daughter with her wedding expenses.

loans.use: to purchase goods from Korea

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 35 years old, married and has been blessed with four children. She runs a beauty salon and has been in business for the past 12 years. She was previously employed in a salon where she got her experience. Her salon is very busy and she has five employees who work on commission. Faulu Kenya has helped her pay school fees for her children and she has managed to buy new salon equipment.

She wishes to open a hardware shop and expand her business. She requests a loan of 42,727 KES to buy hair chemicals, braids, hair oils and a blow dryer.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals, braids, hair oils and a blow dryer

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru:
Хуршид успешно погасив свой предыдущий кредит, решил падать заявку на следующий кредит, так как с помощью предыдущего кредита он намного расширил свой бизнес. Он  занимается разведением скота.  Его жена с матерью ухаживают за скотом, каждое утро доят молоко и производят  различные молочные продукты: сметану, ряженку, творог и продают на рынке. В этом году Хуршид хочет построить еще один коровник, так как с каждым годом скот увеличивается и место в старом коровнике недостаточны для дальнейшего разведения скота.  Этот бизнес у него дает очень хороший доход.  
На полученный кредит Хуршид хочет купить строительные материалы и построить новый коровник.    Он очень рад, что может получить поддержку от КИВА и реализовать свои планы.
texts.en: Having successfully paid back his previous loan, Hurshed has decided to apply for a second loan, as the prior one allowed him to substantially expand his business of raising cattle. His wife and mother-in-law take care of the cows, and every morning they milk them and produce dairy products such as sour cream, ryazhenka (a type of yogurt drink), and cottage cheese, which they then sell at the market. This year Hurshed wants to build another cowshed for his cows because with each passing year, his herd gets larger and his current cowshed is not large enough to accommodate any future expansion. This business is bringing in a very good income for him. Hurshed wants to use this loan to buy building materials so he can build a new cowshed. He is very happy that he can receive the support of Kiva to realise his plans.

loans.use: to purchase of building materials

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru: Мирзоали 29 лет. Он проживает вместе с родителями в городе Дангара. У него среднее образование. Мирзоали с 19 лет занимается животноводством. Он покупает коров и телят, откормливает их и затем продает с наценкой на рынке своего города. Также Мирзоали в свободное время работает таксистом. Мирзоали хочет расширить свой бизнес, и поэтому он берет кредит на сумму 1800 долларов для приобретения крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Mirzoali is 29 years old and he lives with his parents in the town of Dangara. He has a high school education. Since he was 19 years old, he has been working in the field of animal husbandry. He buys cows and calves, fattens them, then sells them for a profit at the local market. In his free time, he also works as a taxi driver. Mirzoali now wants to expand his business, and for this reason, he is seeking a loan of 1,800 dollars to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Samiboy

texts.ru: Самеъбой – активный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Имеет многолетний опыт по изготовлению национальных лепёшек.  Раньше работал в руках у одного пекаря в пекарни, но к его большому сожалению хозяин пекарни уехал в другой город, а пекарня закрылась, и он остался без работы.  Самеъбой, его жена и ребёнок живут с родителями в одной квартире и чтобы как то прокормить семью Самеъбой решил открыть свою пекарню.  На данный момент он арендует помещение и занимается изготовлением лепёшок.  Но в связи с болезни матери он не смог вложить нужную очередную сумму в свой маленький бизнес и на данный момент нуждается в небольшой сумме денег.  Чтобы решить свою проблему и заработать определённую сумму для дальнейшего проживания и содержание семьи  он решил обращаться за кредитом.  На приобретённый кредит планирует закупить муку и уголь. Самеъбой надеется, что этим сможет продвинуть свой бизнес и приобрести определённый доход. Он благодарит  организацию  «Кива» за содействие в его развитие бизнеса и спокойствие в семье.
texts.en: Samiboy is an active and hardworking young man. He has many years of experience producing traditional Tajik flat breads. He used to work in a bakery for another baker, but to his big regret the owner of the bakery moved to another town and the bakery closed down so he was left without work. Samiboy, his wife and child live with parents in one apartment and to be able to feed the family he decided to open his own bakery. At this time he rents out a space where he makes flat breads. Because of his mother's illness he could not invest the necessary amount into his small business and right now needs in a small amount of money. To solve this problem and make the needed amount for living and support of his family he has decided to come for a loan. He plans to use the loan to buy flour and coal. Samiboy hopes that he will be able to advance his business and get a certain profit. He is thanking Kiva for the support in the growth of his business and well being of his family.

loans.use: to purchase coal and flour.

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru: Толибчону 33 года. Он со своей семьей живет в городе Дангара. Толибчон работает охранником в отделе охраны. Одновременно он занимается животноводством. Толибчон покупает крупно-рогатый скот, его жена откармливает их, и затем он сам продает скот на рынке с наценкой. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль, Толибчон запрашивает кредит для закупа скота.
texts.en: Tolibjon is 33 years old and he lives with his family in the town of Dangara. He works as a guard in a security firm. He is also involved in animal husbandry. He purchases cattle, his wife fattens them, then he sells them for a profit at the local market. In order to expand his business and earn a good income, Tolibjon is now seeking a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Erick

texts.es: Erick tiene la edad de 21 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra almacigo de café para resembrar la plantación de café, que está un poco dañada y además quiere comprar insumos como  abono y fumigaciones. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo y resembrar las partes dañadas para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El  trabaja desde hace varios  años en café. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y  poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. . Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Erick is 21 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children. He would like this loan in order to buy coffee seedlings for replanting his coffee plantation, which is a bit damaged. He would also like to buy supplies like fertilizer and fumigants. He would like to perform adequate maintenance for his crops and to replant the damaged parts. This would allow him to improve his production and thereby increase his income. Erick has been working with coffee for several years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to continue growing as a person and as a producer. This is the first loan he has received through FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans from state banks either, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and agricultural supplies

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр работает кузнецом. Он арендует помещение размером в 150 квадратных метров для своего кузнечного цеха на территории бывшей фабрики. Александр занимается этим бизнесом уже 9 лет. Изготавливает кованные ворота, перила, разные решётки для окон, делает также художественную ковку. 
Александр обратился к КИВА за кредитом в размере 22 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести оборудование для бизнеса и расширять свое дело. Александр разносторонне развитый человек: он не только замечательный мастер, но хороший семьянин и любитель активного отдыха. Он любит ездить в горы на велосипеде, устраивает веломаршруты на несколько дней, проводя таким образом время с семьей.
texts.en: Alexander works as a blacksmith. He rents premises of 150 square meters to use as his work space on the territory of a now-defunct factory. He has been working in this business for 9 years. He makes gates, railings, grilles for windows, and he also produces some artistic items. Alexander has approached Kiva for a loan of 22,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya to purchase some equipment for business so he can expand it. He is a man of diverse interests: he is not only a remarkable blacksmith, but a good family man who loves active holidays. He enjoys biking to the mountains and he maps out bike routes that are several days in duration for him and his family to ride together.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his business

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 41-year-old woman. She is a responsible mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband died a few years ago. After his death, she has faced a very difficult time. Her elder son is a rickshaw driver. 

Shehnaz is an efficient and excellent tailor. For the past six years, she has been operating her tailoring business. She provides tailoring services in her community. She currently needs to purchase some products, like threads, needles, clothes etc for her tailoring business.

To do that she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the loan will help increase production.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products, like threads, needles and clothing for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.ru:
Ярослав живет в городе Хуст, Западная Украина. Он торгует на одном из местных рынков женской одеждой по сезону, а именно колготками, лосинами, гольфами, кофтами и блузами. Вначале трудно было начинать этот бизнес, но потом Ярослав наладил поставку товара и бизнес стал развиваться. 
Ярославу понадобилась сумма в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию лосин и колгот для весеннего сезона, а также блузки и кофточки. Ярослав планирует улучшать условия проживания своей семьи и постепенно расширять бизнес, копя деньги на образование детей.
texts.en:
Yaroslav lives in the Western Ukrainian city of Khryst. He sells seasonal women's clothing - stockings, leggings, turtlenecks, jackets, and shirts - at a local market. Initially, it was difficult for him to start his business, but once Yaroslav established a product assortment, his business began to develop. 

Yaroslav needs 20,000 griven in order to purchase shirts and jackets as well as leggings and stockings for the spring season. He plans to improve the living standard of his family and gradually expand his business while saving money for his childrens' education.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of shirts and jackets as well as leggings and stockings for spring.

loans.name: Marlene Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora Marlene Emperatriz es originaria de diriamba Carazo pero desde hace años se traslado a vivir a Managua por circunstancia de la vida, donde ella se desempeña como maestra de primaria desde hace quince año en un colegio del estado. 

Solicita un  préstamo a ceprodel para invertirlo en  compra  de  útiles escolares  tales como uniforme, mochila, cuaderno. Esto con el propósito de dar a su hija una buena educación para que el futuro sea toda una profesional.

Confía en dios y pide el apoyo a kiva a través de ceprodel para que le faciliten este crédito ya que sin ello no puede cumplir el sueño de su hija ya que actualmente gana muy poco.
texts.en:
Marlene is originally from Diriamba, in Carazo, Nicaragua, but, due to certain circumstances, some years ago she moved to Managua.  There she is a primary school teacher.  She has been working in a state school for 15 years.

She has come to Ceprodel for a loan to invest in buying school materials such as a uniform, backpack and notebooks.  With this she will be able to give her daughter a good education so that she can be a professional in her future.

She has faith in God and is asking Kiva for support, through Ceprodel, so that she can have this loan.  Without it, her daughter will not be able to realise her dream as Marlene currently earns very little money.

loans.use: to buy school materials.

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
Adriana María de 39 años es una mujer entregada a su familia, motivo que la impulsa a disfrutar y compartir cada instante de su existencia con su hijo y esposo.
Debido a un accidente de trabajo que sufrió su cónyuge esta mujer debió tomar las riendas del hogar y generar los ingresos para la alimentación y la educación de sus tres hijos menores de edad. Radicados en la ciudad de Medellín Adriana decidió trasladarse al municipio de Pueblo Rico, Colombia, debido a que el costo de vida es mucho más bajo. 
Su suegro le regaló un terreno en donde comenzaron a construir su vivienda gracias a venta de productos por catálogo.
Hoy tienen un gran sueño, montar una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, aprovechando la necesidad del sector en donde reside. Para materializar su deseo, esta mujer se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de vitrina, adecuaciones locativas y surtido. Espera que su idea de negocio le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida a su familia y terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Adriana María is 39 years old and completely committed to her family.  She is motivated to enjoy and share every moment of her life with her son and husband.

After her husband suffered accident at work, Adriana had to take control of the household and generate an income to pay for food and education for their three children, all of whom are still minors.  Living in the city of Medellín, Adriana decided to move to the municipality of Pueblo Rico as the cost of living there is much lower.

Her father-in-law gifted Adriana a plot of land where they have started to build a home, thanks to sales of products through catalogues.

The family's dream now is to start a business selling basic household goods, taking advantage of the fact that there is a need for such a store in their local area.  To make this dream a reality Adriana is applying for a loan to invest in buying a glass cabinet, paying for adapting the house for the business and for buying stock.  She hopes that this idea for a business will allow her to improve her family's living conditions and that it will bring an end to work on their home.

loans.use: to buy a glass cabinet, pay for renovations and buy stock (basic household goods).

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en: Fausta is a 39-year-old married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is a primary teacher, and her parents inspired her to go into service. After realizing that teaching alone could not guarantee that she would be able to pay her family's daily expenses, she bought land and now practices commercial agriculture. Pests and diseases are her major challenges. Her dream is to buy more land and grow a variety of crops. Fausta intends to use the loan to buy farming inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farming inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: This time, for her sixth loan cycle, Aida is borrowing 10,000 PHP to buy more coconut for her copra business. The fish vending business that she previously funded through NWTF, a Kiva field partner, continues to provide for Aida and her family and help them to increase their income to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more coconut for her copra business.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 43 years old and married with nine children. Six of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Delma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of items to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, snack foods, detergent, and other groceries. 

In the future, Delma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of items to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a business lady who sells charcoal to earn a living.  She had requested a previous loan which she used to buy more stocks of charcoal. Her business improved, and she repaid her loan. She has requested a loan of 10,428 KES to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: Máxima, de 51 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería en la ciudad de Estelí. Inicio con muy poco capital, no vendía muchos productos poco a poco a cómo podía cada centavo lo invertía en la pulpería con el objetivo de lograr mejorarla cada día. Busco financiamiento para comprar otros productos que no  tenía y que sus clientes le solicitaban.  Después de un tiempo fue adquiriendo más clientela esto le lleno de mucho orgullo pues ha logrado generar ingresos por sí misma y aportar en el hogar.  Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar  granos básico, aceite, papel higiénico, jabón, jugos, agua embotellada, leche , avenas , enlatados. Dentro de sus planes futuros desea convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en: 51-year-old Máxima, who is married with 2 children, owns a small grocery store in the city of Estelí.  As she started out with very little capital, she did not sell many goods, but gradually, whenever she could, she invested every centavo in the grocery store with the aim of making improvements every day.  She is seeking funding to buy other products that she did not have and for which there was a demand from her customers.  After a time, she started to build up her clientele and this has filled her with pride as she has managed to generate income for herself and for her household.  She is applying for funding to buy basic grains, oil, toilet paper, soap, fruit juices, bottled water, milk, oats and tinned goods.  One of her plans for the future is to convert her grocery store into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, toilet paper, soap, fruit juices, bottled water, milk, oats and tinned goods.

loans.name: Lecheritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LECHERITAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Miriam es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ganado, producción de hortalizas, venta de leches, costura de busos, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras, panadería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Miriam es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de comercio de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su suegra, después de su matrimonio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de una vaca lechera) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y de crédito.
texts.en:
The "Lecheritas" communal bank will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Patacamaya regional office.  The group has eight members, directed by a board, the president of which is Miriam.  The members of the communal bank have various types of business, including: cattle selling, producing vegetables, selling milk, blouse-making, grocery stores, selling vegetables and selling bread.

The loan that the group is taking out will benefit the small businesswomen who are members of the same communal bank as Miriam.  She says she joined Pro Mujer six months ago after someone from the institution visited her at home offered her an invitation.  She currently has a milk business, and says she learned this trade from her mother-in-law after she married.

The loan she is taking out is to increase her capital to purchase a dairy cow which she will buy in the neighbouring communities.  Then the capital will go to raising the animal and then selling milk from her fixed post.  This type of work allows Miriam to earn the money to maintain her household as best as possible.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health education and education on the loans.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Sandra Betzabe

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Betzabe es madre soltera, tiene 48 años de edad, cursó los grado de educación secundaria, graduándose de enfermera auxiliar, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando, se dedica a la venta de medicamentos en un local que tiene, inicio este negocio con poco capital y lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de medicamentos, para tener mas variedad en su negocio y poder captar mas clientes de manera mayor, compra de antibióticos, pastillas, inyecciones, jarabes, etc; espera en el futuro tener una grande farmacia y sea reconocida por mucho clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra Betzabe, 48, is a single mother. She finished high school and graduated as an assistant nurse. Sandra has three children; one of them attends school.

Sandra runs an establishment where she sells medicines. She started this business with a small capital eight years ago.

She is requesting a loan to buy medicines to sell, in order to offer a wider variety and be able to attract more customers. She will buy antibiotics, tablets, syringes and syrups, among other things. In the future, she hopes to own a large and well-known pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Amparo tiene 60 años y aún tiene grandes sueños por cumplir. Su vida siempre ha estado colmada con grandes regalos, el mejor, dice ella fue haber tenido su hijo y compartir su vida con un gran hombre. Aunque su situación económica nunca ha sido la mejor le sobran motivos para sonreír. Ama a su familia y es esta quien la llena de fuerzas para seguir adelante. Desde hace más de 30 años, esta mujer labora en sector de la confección directa, realizando prendas para el hogar y arreglos de modistería desde su casa, lo cual le permitió estar pendiente de su familia. Con su actividad logró brindarle a su hijo educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
Su mayor sueño es disfrutar cada día de su bello hogar y no preocuparse por banalidades en la vida. Ama su trabajo como confeccionista, además de ser su gran pasión, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de telas para la confección de ropa escolar, con el fin de aprovechar la temporada estudiantil.
texts.en: Amparo is 60 and still has big ambitions which she wants to fulfil.  Her life has always been filled with great gifts, the best of which, she says, are having had her son and sharing her life with a great man.  Although her financial situation has never been the best, she has ample reasons to smile.  She loves her family and it is they who give her the strength to go on.  For more than 30 years, she has produced and sold clothing directly, producing household textiles and doing clothing alterations from her home and, thereby, providing for her family.  With her business she managed to provide an education and a better quality of life for her son.  Her greatest ambition is to enjoy each day in her beautiful home and not to have to worry about the trivialities of life.  She loves her work as a seamstress and, what is more, sewing is her great passion.  For this reason, she aims to capitalise on the new school term by applying for a loan to purchase fabric for making school uniforms.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Serge Bruno

texts.fr: Serge est un homme de 31 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Actif depuis 01 an, il vend des beignets dans un quartier de la ville. Il sollicite le crédit pour acheter des matières premières (farine, sucre, levure, accessoires des beignets)pour augmenter son niveau de stock qui est moyen et afin d'accroître son chiffre d'affaires ainsi que son profit. le profit dégagé sera utilisé pour réinvestir dans son activité et le reste pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille (éducation de ses enfants, nutrition et santé)
texts.en: Serge is a 31-year-old man who is married and the father of 2 children. He has been selling doughnuts in a district of town for a year. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy ingredients (flour, sugar, yeast, doughnut trimmings) in order to raise his moderate inventory level and increase his sales and profits. Some of the profit generated will be reinvested in his business and the rest will be used to satisfy his family's needs (his children's education, food and healthcare).

loans.use: to buy ingredients with which to make doughnuts.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana de 46 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 21 años de edad. Su pareja nunca se hizo responsable, por lo cual esta mujer se dedicó a laborar con el fin de generar ingresos para educar a su hijo. Laboró por mucho tiempo como empleada del servicio, pero su hijo  se enfermó y se vio en la obligación de retirarse para cuidarlo. En medio de su crisis económica debido a que su trabajo era la única fuente de ingresos. Ana decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercancía por catálogo desde su casa a vecinos y familiares, lo que le permitió estar pendiente del cuidado de su hijo.
Con esta actividad ha logrado sostener su hogar y brindarle educación a su hijo. En la actualidad busca mejorar su situación económica por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de ropa y accesorios con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old. She is a single mother of a 21 year old son. Her spouse never took responsibility, so she decided yo work to generate income to raise her son. She worked for a long time as maid, but her son became ill and she had to leave to take care of him. In the middle of a financial crisis because her job was her only source of income, Ana decided to sell merchandise via catalog from her home to neighbors and family. This allowed her to be around to take care of her son. 

With this activity, she has been able to support her home and offer her son an education. Right now, she is seeking to improve her financial situation and so she is asking for a loan she will use to buy clothing and accessories in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing and accessories)

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.fr: Farida est présidente de l'association de credit Tupendane/Miti. Leader courage et ambitieuse, elle est âgée de 39ans, mère de 7 enfants dont 5scolarisés et mariée à un policier. Engagée dans le petit commerce au centre commercial de Miti, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit pour l'achat des divers denrées alimentaires (oeufs, poissons salés, fretin, tourteau, beignets, etc.). Elle espère accroitre sa petite unité de production avec l'appui de Hekima mais craint la vente à crédit comme il y a pas de cash circulant. La cliente remercie Hekima.
texts.en: Farida is the president of the loan association Tupendane/Miti. A courageous and ambitious leader, she is 39 years old, married to a police officer and the mother of 7 children, 5 of whom attend school. She is a small trader in the commercial centre of Miti and is requesting a new loan so that she can buy various food items (eggs, salted fish, small fry, canola, doughnuts, etc.). She hopes to increase her small output with Hekima's help, but is worried about having to sell on credit as there is no money circulating. The customer thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to buy various food items (eggs, salted fish, small fry, canola, doughnuts, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es: Ezequiel es un joven de 36 años de edad, casado, padre de dos hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad, quienes cursan en la escuela primaria; Ezequiel es propietario de  un taller de pintado y enderezado automotriz, dentro de su taller también ofrece el servicio de soldadura, instaló el taller desde hace nueve años, el cual está ubicado dentro de su vivienda, lo hizo con pocos ahorros que tenía, luego con la ayuda de los créditos ha logrado mejorar poco a poco su negocio , el aprendió el oficio trabajando en otros talleres y solicita el crédito para hacerle mejoras a su taller y ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela. Una de sus metas es seguir mejorando el taller para obtener más ingresos para así realizar mejoras en su vivienda. Ezequiel está muy agradecido con  la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobres como Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Ezequiel is e 36 year old man and the father of two children, aged 12 and 6. They are in primary school. Ezequiel is the owner of a automobile paint and bodywork shop. He also does welding in his shop. He opened his shop nine years ago. It is located at his house and he opened it with the small savings that he had. Later, with the help of loans, he has been able to improve his business little by little. He learned his trade working in other shops and is asking for the loan to do some improvements on his shop and offer his customers a better service. One of his goals is to keep improving the shop in order to obtain more income and be able to do some home improvements. Ezequiel is very grateful for the help the Kiva investors offer people of low income and in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they may have dignified work.

loans.use: to improve his establishment to give his customers a better service.

loans.name: Upole Group

texts.fr: Madame Cibalonza femme dynamique, présidente du groupe Upole est mariée à un homme d'affaire. Agée de 28ans est mère de 8 enfants dont seulement 5 sont scolarisés. Elle débuta le commerce à l’âgé de 15ans grâce aux fonds reçu de son père avant d’adhérer dans le groupe Upole. Engagée dans la commercialisation de haricot qu'elle achète de Goma, elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour s’approvisionner avec 600kgs de haricots. La cliente remercie sincèrement Hekima et pense que toutes les femmes qui remboursement normalement le crédit  iront toujours de l'avant.
texts.en: Madam Cibalonza is a dynamic woman, president of the group Upole, and married to a businessman. Twenty-eight years old, she is mother to 8 children of whom only 5 go to school. She started in business at 15 thanks to the funds received from her father before joining the group Upole. Involved in the commercialisation of beans which she buys in Goma, she is requesting this new loan to supply herself with 600kgs of beans. The client sincerely thanks Hekima and thinks that all the women who properly repay the loan will always get ahead.

loans.use: to buy 600kgs of beans.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ana Teresa

texts.es:
Ana Teresa de 64 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Santa Bárbara, Colombia. Toda su vida le ha gustado trabajar y desde hace 25 años tiene su puesto de trabajo en el parque principal en donde comercializa prendas de vestir masculinas y femeninas. Sus mejores clientes son los campesinos de las zonas aledañas al municipio.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un almacén ubicado en un local, ya que su mayor dificultad es el clima, que en temporada de lluvia, obliga a Ana a recoger su surtido, causándole pérdidas monetarias.

En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercancía, con el fin de surtir su negocio y mejorar sus ventas. Espera poder disfrutar de una linda vejez con sus cuatro hijos, ya que su esposo falleció hace algunos años.
texts.en: Ana Teresa, who is 64, lives in the town of Santa Bárbara in Colombia.  She has always enjoyed working and, for 25 years, she has had her stall in the main park, where she sells men's and women's clothing.  Her best customers are the farmers in the regions bordering the town.  Ana’s greatest dream is to have proper business premises, as the biggest problem she faces is the climate which, in the rainy season, forces her to pack up her stock and lose money.  She is currently applying for a loan to buy merchandise with which to stock her stall and improve her sales.  She hopes to be able to enjoy a pleasant old age with her four children, as she lost her husband several years ago.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Berta Luz

texts.es:
Berta Luz de 59 años de edad, es una campesina desplazada por la violencia con su núcleo familiar por los grupos al margen de la ley. Por lo cual residen en el municipio de Yarumal, Colombia. Allí comenzaron una nueva vida. Su esposo que se ha dedicado desde su juventud a la agricultura, logró emplearse en una finca en donde labora realizando actividades agrícolas. 
Berta desde hace dos años por sugerencia de una amiga inició con la producción de arepas para la venta puerta a puerta. En la actualidad se encuentra produciendo 200 arepas diarias las cuales distribuye en restaurantes y cafeterías de su localidad. 
Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito con el propósito de comprar un molino eléctrico que le ayudará a disminuir tiempo en la producción y desgaste físico, compra de parrillas y maiz. 
Su mayor sueño es poder convertir su negocio en una microempresa, con el fin de crear fuentes de empleo y garantizarles a sus cuatro hijos mejores oportunidades educativos.
texts.en:
Berta Luz is 59 years old. She is a farmer who was displaced with her family by violence committed by groups of outlaws. Because of this, they live in the town of  Yarumal, Colombia. That is where they started a new life. Her husband has been a farmer since he was young and he was able to get a job at a farm where he does agricultural work.

For two years, Berta, at a friend's suggestion, started making arepas to sell door to door. Right now, she produces 200 arepas a day which she distributes to restaurants and cafeterias in her community.

Today she is seeking a loan to buy an electric grinder, which will help her cut down the preparation time and physical effort, as well as to buy grills  and corn. Her biggest dream is to make her business into a micro-business so she can create a source of employments and guarantee her four children better educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy an electric grinder, grills and corn.

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdourahmane, âgé de 57 ans est père de 18 enfants dont l’ainé a 32 ans et le cadet, 10 ans. Il est chauffeur de profession depuis 39 ans dans une banque de la place.  Il commence sa journée à 8h 15mn pour descendre à 17h. Le reste de son temps il le passe dans son chantier à superviser les travaux. Il a embrassé le métier par amour. Avec son revenu plus ou moins consistant il ne peut que recourir à des Institutions financières comme l’IMCEC pour réaliser ses objectifs. Il sollicite un crédit pour la clôture de sa maison. Son seul objectif est de terminer la construction  de son local pour être à l’aise avec sa famille.
texts.en: Mister Abdourahmane, 57 years old, is father to 18 children of whom the oldest is 32 years old and the youngest 10 years old. He has been a driver by profession for 39 years in a local bank. He starts his day at 8:15am to finish at 5pm. He spends the rest of his time on his building site supervising the work. He embraced his profession with love. With his more or less consistent revenue he can only resort to financial institutions like UIMCEC to realize his objectives. He is requesting a loan for the fence of his home. His only objective is to finish the construction of his locale to be comfortable with his family.

loans.use: to build the fence of his home.

loans.name: Absatou

texts.fr:
Mlle Absatou, âgée de 25 ans est une jeune commerçante de par l’âge mais aussi l’expérience dans ce domaine puisqu’elle en a qu’un an. Elle est célibataire sans enfant, et en est à sa première expérience de crédit. Avec ce dernier elle pourra acheter des tissus en variété pour revendre dans le quartier et les environs ou elle possède une clientèle pas mal. A partir de là elle pourra commencer à épargner et penser sérieusement à son avenir. Elle n’a pas de charges sinon ses propres besoins.
Comme projet futur, elle désire élargir son activité et surtout la diversifier.
texts.en: Mademoiselle Absatou, 25 years old, is a young shopkeeper by age but also by her experience in this domain because she only has one year's experience. She is single without children, and is on her first loan experience. With this loan she will be able to buy a variety of fabric to resell in the neighborhood and surroundings where she has not a bad clientele. From here she will be able to begin to save and think seriously about her future. She has no responsibilities other than her own needs. As a future project, she wants to expand her business and especially diversify it.

loans.use: to buy fabric to resell.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr:
Madame Aby, une dame de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 22 ans et le plus jeune, 7 ans. Elle travaille dans une boite de la place et commence sa journée à 8h 15mn, pour descendre à 18h le soir. Elle a une expérience de 5 ans dans ce domaine. Pour ce qui concerne ses dépenses, elle se prend elle-même en charge. Elle a déjà eu un crédit et veut renouveler afin d’appuyer  socialement son père qui fait des activités commerciales.
Par contre elle aimerait ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter et de tissus voilà son vœu le plus cher.
texts.en: Madam Aby, a 42 year old woman, is married and mother to 5 children of whom the oldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 7 years old. She works in a local company and starts her day at 8:15am to finish at 6pm at night. She has 5 years experience in this domain. For that which concerns her expenses, she takes care of herself. She has already had a loan and wants to renew in order to socially support her father who is in commercial business. On the other hand she would like to open a boutique of ready-to-wear clothing and fabric, this is her dearest wish.

loans.use: to help her father to strengthen his commercial business.

loans.name: Théodore

texts.fr: Théodore est un jeune Camerounais âgé de 36 ans qui mène comme activité la fabrication artisanale et vente des pièces détachées automobiles telles que les cylimbloques qui servent à garnir les freins des véhicules. il bénéficie de 02 années d'expérience dans ce domaine. il voudrait avec ce crédit effectuer des travaux d’aménagement de son site afin de la rendre moderne et un peu plus attractif. il compte faire des économies pour ouvrir un garage
texts.en: Théodore is a young, 36-year-old Cameroonian man who crafts and sells car spare parts, like silent blocks which are used with car brakes. He has 2 years of experience in this line of work. He would like to use this loan to carry out some refurbishment work on his work site in order to modernise it and make it a bit more attractive. He plans to build his savings so that he can open a garage.

loans.use: to carry out refurbishment work.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en: Kellen, a 49-year-old married mother of five living in Kamwenge, Uganda, operates a retail shop, earns a salary as a teacher, and also has a cattle farm. With the money earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children, and one is now at the University. Her dream is to see her children attain degrees as minimum qualifications and also to own a wholesale shop. Kellen intends to use this loan to fence her farm.

loans.use: to fence her farm.

loans.name: Nilma

texts.en:
Nilma is a 42-year-old woman living in Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has three children. She and her husband have a fishing business. 

Nilma is asking for a loan to buy materials for repairing their boat, such as plywood, nails and paint. 

With these items they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the boat and eventually improve their fishing business.

loans.use: to buy materials for repairing a fishing boat.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 38 years old and married. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been doing this for ten years and also earns additional income by raising ducks.

Myra is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 56-year-old married man with seven children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a cattle farmer and also grows maize and sorghum. Every day he sells 20 litres of milk at 1000 Ugandan shillings each. Diseases and limited farmland pose a challenge to the growth of his business.

Andrew intends to use his loan to buy cattle for rearing.

His dream is to set up a milk processing plant.

loans.use: to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.name: Gisele Stephanie

texts.fr: Gisele stephanie est une femme de 40 ans mariée mèer de 05 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle vend du poisson  fumé dans un marché de la place. engagée dans cette activité depuis plus de  6 ans son activité marche bien car elle maitrise l'environnement de son marché. Elle sollicite le crédit pour augmenter son capital compte tennue de la demande croissante envue de fournir la quantitée demandé par ses clients;etendre son activitée et. le profit degagé sera utiliser pour payer les etudes de ses enfants et le reste re-investi dans son activité.
texts.en: Gisele Stephanie is a 40 year old woman, married and mother to 5 children all in school. She sells smoked fish at a local market. Involved in this business for more than 6 years her business functions well as she masters the environment of her market. She is requesting the loan to increase her capital taking account of the growing demand with the vision of supplying the quantity requested by her customers and to extend her business. The profit generated will be used to pay for the studies of her children and the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of gowns, dresses, tuxedos and slacks.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alassane est un homme de 54 ans qui est entré très vite dans le biseness ; cela fait 24 ans maintenant. Il est marié et père de 21 enfants dont le plus âgé a 27 ans et le cadet, 1 an. Avec  le nombre considérable de sa progéniture, Alassane est obligé de travailler dure pour nourrir sa famille. C’est un boulanger de profession mais cela ne l’empêche pas de faire de la vente de produits divers afin de maximiser son profit. Sur la photo on peut voire comment il s’active dans son travail et cela d’une telle assiduité car il adore son métier. Il démarre sa journée à 6h du matin pour descendre à 19h du soir. Il a besoin de 400000Fcfa pour acheter de la marchandise diverse alimentaire et revendre.
Il rêve un jour d’ouvrir un grand magasin d’alimentation général et une boulangerie moderne.
texts.en: Mister Alassane is a 54 year old man who entered very quickly into business; it has been 24 years now. He is married and father to 21 children of whom the oldest is 27 years old and the youngest 1 year old. With the considerable number of his offspring, Alassane is obliged to work hard to feed his family. He is a baker by profession but this does not prevent him from selling various products in order to maximize his profit. In the photo we can see how he is active in his work and with such diligence as he loves his profession. He starts his day at 6am in the morning to finish at 7pm at night. He dreams of opening a large general food store and a modern bakery one day.

loans.use: to buy various foodstuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 25kg of manioc flours, corn, spices, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old, married and supporting a family of three. He has been running a tailoring business for the last eight years, making a monthly income of 27,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD. He plans to buy materials for dressmaking. 

He will purchase more clothing materials with the anticipated profits. 

His future dream is to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Georgette Solange

texts.fr: Georgette est une camerounaise de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle possède et gère un petit pressing depuis 15 ans dans un quartier de la ville. Dynamique et chaleureuse, elle voudrait augmenter sa capital matériel pour satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante. Ce crédit qu'elle sollicite va lui permettre d'acheter une machine à laver. Les bénéfices générés seront réinvestis dans l'activité pour l'agrandir, ouvrir une bcentre bureautique et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Georgette is a 33 year old Camerounian married woman and mother of two children. For the past 15 years she has owned and managed a small dry cleaning operation in a neighborhood of the city in which she lives. She is dynamic and charismatic, and hopes to increase her equipment in order to satisfy an ever growing number of customers. The loan she is asking for will enable her to purchase a washing machine. Profits from her activity will be re-invested into the business to further its growth, including an adminstrative 'center', and to attend to the needs of her family.

loans.use: purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is an 48 years old married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy blouses, trousers, shorts etc. for resale.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, shorts etc. for resale

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en: Prescila is a 23-year-old woman and the mother of a 3-year-old daughter from Bohol, Philippines. Prescila has been engaged in a sari-sari or variety store business for several years now. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, like rice, canned goods, noodles, beverages, food seasonings, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to sell more items to her customers, thus augmenting her profit and income. In the future, Prescila hopes of expanding her store and saving money for the future schooling of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like rice, canned goods, noodles, beverages, food seasonings, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 61 years old, married, and has five children. She is selling grocery items to the people in her village and gains about P5,000 each month. It goes for the family's subsistance. She hopes to keep selling good products and to increase sales; that is why she is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy more merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, soap and shampoo to sell in her store. 

Cecilia will keep adding good products and services to achieve the good development of her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, soap and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosefe

texts.en:
Rosefe is 45 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school. Rosefe is in an agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been in business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Rosefe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase shampoo, eggs, snack foods, sugar, groceries and other items to sell in her general store. 

Evelyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, eggs, snack foods, sugar, and groceries.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, eggs, snack foods, sugar, groceries and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина – из Гладковки. Она занимается теплицами в своем селе уже 20 лет. У неё есть 36 соток собственной земли, и ещё дополнительно 11 соток она арендует у соседа. На этом участке Ирина выращивает ранние, средние и поздние овощи, а именно помидоры, огурцы, а также белокачанную и цветную капусту.  
Сумма в 15 000 гривен понадобилась Ирине для того, чтобы закупить удобрения, пленку, семена и построить дополнительную теплицу в преддверии нового сельскохозяйственного сезона.
texts.en:
Irina is from Gladkovka. She has been involved in the greenhouse business for 20 years now. She has her own plot of land which is 36 are in size (1 are is equal to 100 square meters), and rents another 11 are from a neighbour. On this land she grows early, mid, and late vegetables, in  particular, tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage and cauliflower. 
Irina needs to borrow 15,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya to buy fertilizer, plastic covering, and seeds, and to build another greenhouse in anticipation of the new growing season.

loans.use: to build another greenhouse and to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and plastic covering

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en:
Evelinda is 44 years old, married, and has two children who are both in school. Evelinda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 22 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, shampoo and other miscellaneous items. In the future, Evelinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
“Faith and determination will prevail you.” This is a phrase spoken by a 30-year-old woman who is engaged in a general store business. She believes in the phrase because most of the successful persons she knows are victorious because of faith and hard work. She really admires them because she was influenced by these very good traits.  

Now, she wants to make her own identity to lift up her living from insufficiency. She is wishing to expand her business so that her income will increase. At the present she is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase canned goods, biscuits, coffee, juice, shampoo, sugar and cooking oil. She hopes to win in this battle for the continuous improvement of her living and in providing satisfaction in the life that God has given to her.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, biscuits, coffee, juice, shampoo, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy products like lotion, shampoo, lipsticks, perfumes, etc. to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business for 1 year and also earns an income from a general store. Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy products like lotion, shampoo, lipsticks, perfumes, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried fish. In the future, Lucy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried fish.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is a 56-year-old married woman and the mother of nine children. They live in Bohol, Philippines. Ramona and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of their income.

Ramona dreams of expanding their fishing business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this, she is applying for a loan to buy a new fishing boat, fishing nets and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market and augment their profit and income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing boat, fishing nets and buckets

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 42 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marichu has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marichu requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a new engine and repair her fishing boat.

Marichu has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Marichu would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 60 years old and married with five children. Ofelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, sugar, canned goods, snack foods, groceries, etc., to sell in her general store.

Ofelia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, canned goods, snack foods, groceries, etc.

In the future Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, sugar, canned goods, snack foods, groceries, etc., to sell in her general store

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Norma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is relisting Norma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 40 years old and married with six children. Five of her children are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Rosario has been in this business for 15 years. She sells a variety of items such as sugar, bread, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old and married with twelve children. With six children currently in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy shampoo, biscuits, egg, can goods, groceries and other items to sell in her general store.

Erlinda has been in this business for 2 years. She sells a variety of items,such as shampoo, biscuits, egg, can goods, and groceries. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, biscuits, egg, can goods, groceries and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Joselina

texts.en:
Joselina is 42 years old, married, and lives peacefully in Solana with her spouse and children. Joselina has a business selling livestock feed to the people in their village. She gains minimal income in her business but she manages her income well for their sustenance. She appreciates her family's thriftiness.

She would like to increase her sales, and that is why she is now asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more sacks of livestock feed to sell. This will increase her profits as well. Someday, with continuous perseverance, Joselina will develop her business and improve her family's current living situation.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of livestock feed to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 42 years old and married with two children. With her children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Shirley runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her general store, like shampoo, canned goods, sugar, oil, groceries, etc. In the future Shirley would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, sugar, oil, groceries, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Ma.theresa

texts.en:
Ma.Theresa is 48 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like blouses, pants, jewelry and other ready-to-wear clothing. In the future, Ma.Theresa would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like blouses, pants, jewelry and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 48 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosalia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rosalia has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Rosalia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей – фермер-огородник. Он живёт в селе Хатки, в южном регионе Украины и уже 13 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством. Андрей с самого начала взял в аренду 6 больших теплиц, чтобы выращивать в них ранние редис, капусту и перец. 
Андрею понадобилась сумма в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить удобрения и химию, семена, дрова, пленку и капельные шланги, а также нанять работников на посев редиски и высадку рассады.
texts.en: Andrei is a garden-farmer. He lives in the village of Khatki in southern Ukraine. For the last 13 years, he has been in the greenhouse business. From the very beginning, Andrei has rented 6 large greenhouses where he grows early radishes, cabbages, and peppers. Andrei now needs a loan of 15,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya to buy fertilizers and chemicals, seeds, firewood, plastic covering and hoses for drip irrigation, as well as to hire workers to help with planting radishes and transplanting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and chemicals, seeds, firewood, plastic covering and hoses for drip irrigation, as well as to hire workers to help with planting radishes and transplanting

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is 45 years old and lives with her two children, ages 17 and 12. She still runs her cereal business, and her monthly income has increased to 15,000 KES.

She is now servicing her second loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD and will to use this amount to stock more dry beans and maize for resale.  

The anticipated profits from the business will be ploughed back into her business. She hopes to educate her children and prosper in her business.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Roxanne runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Roxanne has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items. In the future Roxanne would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kerstine

texts.en:
Kerstine, a 27-year-old married mother of one child, works very hard to provide for her family. For the past three years she has been running a general store in the Philippines selling a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, biscuits, egg, groceries, etc.

Kerstine has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more such items to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as shampoo, sugar, biscuits, egg, groceries, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a rice grower in Alcala. He lives with his wife and two children. He plants and harvests rice to sell. Through his income in selling the rice crop, Danilo is able to send his children to school and provide their school fees. He was determined to send them to school because he has no legacy other than a good education for them. Danilo usually gains about P25,000 each harvest season twice a year. 

His crops need farm supplies; that is why he is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming. It will help nourish his crops for better production. With good income from the business, Danilo will continue to give the best education to his children and will improve the family's living conditions as well.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for five years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Heraldo

texts.en:
Heraldo, age 19, is a young farmer who lives in the beautiful village of Laguna, a few miles off the Southern highway.  The village is named Laguna because it houses a lagoon with various species of birds. He is currently living with his parents along with his older brother and younger sister. His dad recently passed his cacao farm onto Heraldo to instead focus on his annatto and ginger farm. 

Besides his cacao farm, Heraldo also grows other crops like bananas, plantains, coconuts, corn and other ground foods for home use. “I like to drink a glass of cacao before going to the farm so that I can have energy to work,” says Heraldo. He likes cacao farming because there is a good market for it. To protect his cacao and practice the sport, Heraldo goes out hunting cacao-eating animals. His favorite part of cacao farming is pruning, because he knows it’s an investment to make his trees more productive in the upcoming season.

Heraldo, who farms six acres, has a passion for cacao and spends most of his time on his farm on small tasks like removing suckers and infected pods. When referring to suckers, farmers mean excess branches on their cacao, which “suck” the plant’s energy away from the fruit pods to the branches. At harvesting time the entire family pitches in to get the job done faster. Heraldo owns a horse and uses it to bring the wet beans home during peak season – March through May.  

Heraldo is requesting a loan to hire people in the community to help him clean and prune his cacao farm and establish a nursery for his first expansion. Cleaning is the process of chopping the entire overgrown bush around the farm to improve air circulation through the plants. Pruning is the process of removing of nonproductive branches from the trees and is performed to improve yields. Heraldo will establish a nursery so that he can have a centralized location to bag soil and expand his cacao farm with high yielding varieties.

loans.use: To clean, prune cacao and establish nursery

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 35 años es una mujer sencilla. Enviudó hace 4 años, desde entonces cuida de sus 3 hijos: Jesus, Jhosep y Angie a los que cuida en la casa que alquiló hace 6 años. Su trabajo desde 5 años se centra en la limpieza de una institución pública, ella recibe un pago mensual, por un contrato de un año, el cual cuida minuciosamente. “Tuve que postular a un concurso de limpieza anual, yo tengo que poner todo los productos de limpieza e insumos que se necesiten, cambio ellos me pagan el monto del servicio anual, pero en pagos mensuales”. Como el trabajo no es pesado ella misma trabaja en la limpieza de las instalaciones desde la mañana hasta el atardecer. Espera poder continuar con ese trabajo, está pensando más adelante tener trabajadores para ella y así concursar en la limpieza de diversas instituciones públicas mucho más grandes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “niño Jesús” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios.
Elizabeth, invertirá el dinero en la compra de productos de limpieza para desarrollar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 35, is an unassuming woman.  She was widowed four years ago, and ever since she has been raising her three children, Jesus, Jhosep, and Angie in the house she rented six years ago.

Her job for the past five years has been cleaning a public institution.  She receives her pay monthly for her contract of one year, and she takes great care with it.  “I had to apply for the annual cleaning contract.  I have to get  all of the cleaning products and supplies that are needed.  They, in turn, pay me the annual service amount, but in monthly payments.”

As the work is not difficult, she cleans the installations herself.  She does this from the morning until the evening.  She hopes to be able to continue with this work.  Later on, she is planning on having workers to do so.  This way she will apply to clean several much larger public institutions.

She belongs to the Niño Jesús communal bank, and this is her eighth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the opportunity to progress.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  She likes belonging to her communal bank, where they are all close-knit and supportive.

Elizabeth will use the loan to buy cleaning products to do her work.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to do her work.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 42 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, sugar and other groceries in her general store. In the future Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, sugar and other groceries in her general store.

loans.name: Kyobe

texts.en:
Kyobe is 40 years old and married. His four children are between the ages of 1 and 13. He sells human drugs and has been in operation for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of about KES 12,000. 

He is now servicing his third loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase drugs for resale. The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and for the upkeep of his family. Kyobe hopes to educate his children and own a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase drugs for his business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 36 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. 

Nida has a business buying and selling mangoes. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional mango fruits to sell.

Nida has been a member of PMPC for almost 12 years. In the future, Nida hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional mangoes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 32 years old, married and has three children. He earns a living as a tailor. He has employed two people in the business. He also does farming to generate more income. He has improved his business since he joined Faulu Kenya, thanks to the training he received in business management skills from Faulu Kenya.

John hopes to become more financially stable in the future. He needs a loan of 10,428 KES to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.ru:
Дмитрий занимается выращиванием овощей в тепличных условиях в селе Гладковка. Этим бизнесом он занимается уже 21 год. На 33 сотках Дмитрий выращивает в теплицах 6 000 кустов ранних и поздних помидор, 3 000 кустов огурцов, 1 тонну редиса и 3 000 кустов перца.   
Дмитрий обратился к КИВА за дополнительными средствами в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пленку, удобрения, семена и провести отопление в теплицах, чтобы подготовить их к сезону. Прибыль Дмитрий намеревается продолжать вкладывать в развитие своего хозяйства и постепенно развивать его дальше.
texts.en: Dmitriy earns a living by growing vegetables in greenhouses in the village of Gladkovka. He has been involved in this business for 21 years now. On a plot of land of 33 are (1 are is equal to 100 square meters), he grows 6,000 early and late tomato plants, 3,000 cucumber plants, 1 tonne of radishes, and 3,000 pepper plants. Dmitriy is now approaching Kiva for a second loan of 20,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya so he can buy plastic covering, fertilizers, and seeds, and to begin heating his greenhouses in order to prepare them for the growing season. He plans to use the profit generated by this loan to re-invest into his business and gradually develop it further.

loans.use: to buy plastic covering, fertilizers, and seeds, and to begin heating his greenhouses in order to prepare them for the growing season

loans.name: Hue's Group

texts.en:
Hue was born in 1970. She has two sons. The older son is learning in the 6th grade. The younger child is learning in the 4th grade. Her husband is a farmer. His income is about 2,000,000 VND per month. Hue collects iron scraps to earn a living. She also raises chickens to earn more money for her family. She gains about 3,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

She began participating in SEDA's credit program in 2013. In this first loan, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. Her dream is for her children to have good careers.

Other members who are part of Hue's group include the following: 

Lieu was born in 1982. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. 
Huong was born in 1974. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy food for her pigs. 
Thanh was born in 1971. She has two children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to grow rice. 
Hang was born in 1977. She has three children. She raises pigs to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en: Seda is involved in cattle breeding. Her livestock currently includes 3 cows, 2 pigs, 16 little pigs and 10 chickens. She is 59-year-old and lives with her son, daughter-in-law and 2 grandchildren. The family's only source of income is agriculture, so it is very difficult for Seda to cover the family's daily costs and at the same time keep the livestock. So, Seda applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This will enable her to feed the livestock and continue the expansion of her farm. The loan is very important for Seda to gather high income and ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафрузу 37 лет. Она очень трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Дилафруз замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она всегда стремится к новшеству и старается улучшить условию проживания. Дилафруз недавно участвовала в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 14500 сомони для покупки холодильника для продуктового магазина, так как она будет продавать молочные продукты. Она ждет вашу доброту.
