loans.use: to expand her feed and chicken raising business.

loans.name: Victorious G Group

texts.en:
Victorious G group has 10 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Margaret, the group's representative, is pictured on the right of Victorious G Group, with her hand raised. The group is comprised of the two men and eight women pictured here. Margaret will receive inputs on credit, sufficient to plant ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize.

Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use her increased profits to send her children to school. Margaret describes her last year's harvest as good, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future.

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Margaret’s group will receive a total of five acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Bulondo H Group

texts.en:
Hansan is a member of Bulondo H Group in Bungoma South District. He is pictured with ten One Acre Fund farmers, six women and four men. Hansan is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Hansan first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Hansan joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer and to grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Hansan was only able to harvest six bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 13 bags per ½ acre. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and invest in cows. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Hansan’s group will receive five acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, who is 24 years old, lives in the Sagarejo District with her husband and infant child. Nino requested loans from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural start-up business, but with no success. Her loan request was rejected each time due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The income for the family comes from an animal husbandry business. Specifically, they own pigs and sell the pork and piglets seasonally. As well, Nino’s husband transports wood from the forest that he sells to the villagers, but their income is hardly enough to feed a three-member family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs in the vulnerable poor category.

Nino requested a loan from Credo to start up a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides for business start-ups and re-startups. It has credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income.

With the received credit, Nino will purchase two milk cows which she will house in an old, empty farm building located in the yard. Nino will work hard on the farm and will sell milk in the village. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start a dairy farm.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: Melba is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married, and has 8 school-aged and adult children. Melba owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,700 PHP a month. In 2011, Melba joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situations and her ability to engage in business activities. Melba is requesting a new loan of 5,000PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Faulu Group

texts.en:
Norisis is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Faulu Group members. The 10 of them, 6 women and 4 men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Norisis first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  Norisis joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family, access the best input prices, and have inputs delivered prior to planting time.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Norisis was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize per 1 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, he was able to harvest 5 bags per ½ acre. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Norisis’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Satta

texts.en: Satta lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married with seven children between the ages of 2 and 22 years old. Only six of the children are attending school and live at home. She did not attend grade school but she was able to attend a vocation school. She is very good at managing her home affairs. For the past three years, she has been making and selling local soap in her community and market.  She spends four hours making the soap and she spends five hours to distribute the soap to her customers in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of making local soap from a school. She is requesting a loan to purchase more caustic, oil, and wood for her business. In the near future, she would like to have a car.

loans.use: to purchase more caustic, oil, and woods to make soap

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 25 years old and lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is single and has two children who are five and eight years old. Her children attend school and they all live at home. For the past five years, she has been operating a provision shop where she sells artificial hair. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair for her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 33 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is a single woman with 5 children between the ages of 5 to 13. They all live at home and her children are in school. For 4 years now she has been selling fish and oil at the local market. She started this business, which was given to her by her husband, and learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish and oil for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and oil for her business

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 21 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is single with a four-month-old child. She is also a grade eleven student. For three years now, she has been selling soap at the local market. She started this business, which was given to her by her mother, and learned this trade from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 56 years old, with 3 children, from Dalarik village of Armavir region and is involved in agriculture. He keeps two cows, gets milk and uses it in cheese production. Then he sells the cheese in a local market and gets income which helps him to cover his family's basic costs. But for a family of five, this income is hardly enough for making ends meet.

So, Samvel has applied for this loan to expand his farm. The loan will help him to purchase two cows, an ox and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for Samvel to increase the livestock, gather a high income and secure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows, an ox and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Natundwe Group

texts.en:
Natundwe is a group of 14 farmers, 10 women and 4 men, in Bungoma South District represented by Charles, on the right of the photo with his hand raised. He will receive farming inputs on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Charles joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Charles joined One Acre Fund so that he could benefit from new farming techniques and grow enough food for the family.

Charles reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 6 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 14 bags per 1/2 acre. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to save for the future. Charles’ group members will each receive input loans of ½ an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season, for a group total of 7 acres of maize and sorghum. The field officer is standing on the far left of the photo in a yellow T-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania has used her previous loan to expand her business by adding baby diapers, more detergents and hooka flavors to her inventory. Rania is now applying for another loan to increase her quantity of goods and to renovate her storage room to fit different types of goods.

loans.use: to bring in more goods

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana, 26 years old, is married to an electrician and they have a 2-year-old daughter. Rana started a small home business in hairstyling that she wants to turn into a beauty salon. She started out using her own hair dryer but bought hair pins and brushes. Now Rana has applied for a youth loan to bring in new equipment and tools to enhance the services she offers.

loans.use: to bring in new equipment and tools

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair is a 24-year-old mother of two kids. Her husband is a governmental officer.

Suhair has a small shop where she sells clothes that she gets from a free-zone market at wholesale prices.  She is applying for a youth loan to get more styles of clothes.

loans.use: to get more styles of clothes.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 57 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She's been engaged with her business over 20 years, and earns 7,000PHP. Elsa joined GDMPC in 2011. Elsa is requesting a loan of 9,500PHP to purchase additional fish, shrimp, and crab. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Victorious B Group

texts.en:
Victorious B group is comprised of 13 farmers, 8 women and 5 men, in Bungoma South District. Alice, the group's representative, is pictured with the rest of the group, on the right with her hand raised. Alice will receive, on credit, farming inputs sufficient to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Alice joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2007, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. She joined One Acre Fund so that she could get good training on farming and grow enough food for the family.

Alice reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 1.5 bags of maize per half-acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 7 bags per half-acre. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, and to invest in cows. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Alice’s group members will take input loans of ½ an acre each.  In total, Victorious B group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Telman

texts.en: Telman lives in the Sagarejo District. He is 36 years old and lives with his wife, child, brother, sister and sister-in-law. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have three milk cows whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, Telman works as an artisan and earns a monthly income.  Several times, Telman has requested loans from local credit providers, but his loan requests are always rejected because of the lack of experience in the new business. His current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the received credit, Telman will start a canteen in his village. He will purchase dishes and renovate the space where he will start the business. Telman hopes his business will be profitable and that he will attract many customers since there is no similar canteen nearby. The profit will be reinvested in the same business and Telman will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to start a canteen

loans.name: Prena

texts.en:
Prena is 55 years old and has five children. They all live in the northwest part of the country. 

She has been selling milk and baby calves to locals for almost twenty years. Prena is happy with the profit she’s been generating from the activity, yet “it’s very exhausting,” she said. “I have to milk the cows every morning and evening and then in the mornings, I must take the milk to every client. And this is a daily routine that has been going on for all these past twenty years,” she added. 

Prena now wants to improve her animals’ living conditions and is applying for a loan to build a new stable. The amount she is requesting is a total amount of 200,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: to improve her animals' living conditions by building a new stable for them

loans.name: Elvard

texts.en:
Elvard is 47 years old. He lives in the small village of Agara with his family: his father (retired), his wife and 5-year-old daughter. The income source for the family is the retirement pension of Elvard’s father and a small monthly salary earned by Elvard’s wife working as a teacher locally. 

Elvard is involved in agricultural business. In particular, he owns beehives with bee colonies and sells honey seasonally. Elvard owns agricultural land but he didn’t have financial resources for seasonal agricultural work and plowing. Now his loan request has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with easy conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Elvard will plow the land and purchase potato seeds. He will sow it and work hard on the plot during the spring season. After properly done seasonal work, Elvard will get a good harvest in summer. He will sell harvested products to local retailers. The income of the family will increase. 

Elvard plans to save some funds for sowing more potatoes next year. The living conditions of the family will improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and cultivate his land

loans.name: Umoja Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Charles, who is in his mid-20s, is single. He has been running several businesses selling telephone accessories and airtime for the phones. He works from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Charles' 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy another computer, office chairs and office tables, and to pay rent and household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He will use this loan to buy more telephone accessories like housing and batteries for phones and air time for the phones. He has a dream of making his business bigger than it is now.

Charles will share this loan with his group "Umoja Kigogo", with 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy housing, batteries and more airtime for phones.

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla is a 43-year-old married woman. Her husband works in the wholesale distribution business. They have 5 sons and daughters. Using her husband’s expertise, she gets blankets and clothes to sell at her house at a higher price to neighbors and friends. Now Abla is applying for a loan to obtain more blankets and winter clothing items to increase her profits.

loans.use: to get more blankets and winter clothing items.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en: Yusra, 59 years old, is widowed. She supports her two sons from the income she makes selling blankets, kitchenware, appliances and olive oil, based on the demand and the season. Yusra is now concentrating on selling blankets and warm bed covers. She is applying for a loan to increase her quantity of blankets.

loans.use: to increase her quantity of blankets.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 54 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest-producing rubber plantation area in Liberia. Annie is married and has four children, ages 17 to 32 years. Only one lives at home and is in school. Annie was not fortunate enough to attend school.

Annie has been involved in business for the past 21 years, and presently she is selling food items, such as salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion and tomato, in the local market. She started this business with 5,000 LRD given to her by her mother, and she learned this trade from her, also. Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion and tomato, for her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more items to resell, such as salt, rice, oil, pepper, vita, onion and tomato

loans.name: Gjystina

texts.en:
Gjystina is 52 years old, married, and has six children, the youngest of whom is 12 years old. They live in the northeast of Albania. In the region where they reside, there are power outages all the time, and flooding as well. While last year, their region was covered in snow that brought severe loss in almost every household, this year they are suffering from flooding. Despite all the struggles caused by weather conditions, Gjystina has been operating an agricultural business for almost nine years. 

“With all the hard work, I would have probably secured a better life for all of us; yet, after all the extreme weather events, at least I can bring the basics for my family,” she said.  “I want to build a stable now for the animals, because I have been sheltering them at my neighbors' place during these past cold and rainy months,” Gjystina added.

loans.use: To build a stable for her animals

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita, this 35-year-old lady, is married and has three young children who are 12, 8 and 4 years old. They live in a little coastal village in northeastern Albania.

In addition to looking after her young children, she has been buying fruits and veggies from people in her village and selling them in some town markets. “It is not that I earn a big income from this activity maybe, but it is something; and it is some sort of help for people of my village as well. So, it works both ways,” Merita said.

Merita is requesting a loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek to buy more inventories to sell.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of fruits and veggies to sell

loans.name: Kongoni Youth Group

texts.en:
Titus is a member of the Kongoni Youth Group in Bungoma South District. He is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers - 4 women and 6 men. Titus is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Titus first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 long rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 long rains season. Titus joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best training in agriculture and grow enough food for his family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Titus was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize per half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the 2012 long rains, he was able to harvest 13 bags per half acre. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair his home, and invest in cows. For the 2013 long rains season, Titus’ group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Fathi

texts.en: Fathi is a 19-year-old single guy, and he has three younger brothers. Fathi is a second-year student majoring in Computer Networking. He is now applying for an educational loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Helal

texts.en: Helal is a 20-year-old man who has one brother and one sister. After their father passed away, Helal start working in different part-time jobs to be able to make a living and pay his university fees. He is now applying for an educational loan to help him pay the rest of the fees so he can register for the next semester.

loans.use: pay the rest of his university fees

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit has been involved in agriculture for 10 years already.  She keeps 10 chickens and owns an agricultural plot of land where pear and apricot trees are grown. She works hard to gather a good harvest, as her main income comes from selling the harvested produce in local markets.

Anahit also owns a greenhouse which is old and needs to be renovated. She has applied for this loan to purchase tomato seeds and polyethylene covers for her greenhouse. This will enable her to improve her greenhouse and start the cultivation of tomatoes.

Anahit lives in Dimitrov village of Ararat region with her husband and three children. It is very important for Anahit to gather a good harvest and earn high income so she is able to sustain her family and cover her children's basic costs.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds and polyethylene covers for greenhouse

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 57-year-old mother of a son and a daughter who goes to the university. To be able to pay for her daughter’s university fees, Siham opened a clothing shop for which she wants to enhance its decoration and bring in a new collection of clothes. That's why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to bring a new collection of clothes to her clothing shop

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en: Hashem is a 20-year-old single man living with his seven siblings. Hashem is a university student majoring in gymnastic and sports education. He is applying for an educational loan to help with paying for his fees next semester.

loans.use: To pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en: Kefah is a 38-year-old conservative woman (her husband took her place in the photo). The two have a medium-sized food market that she works at during the day while her husband is working on his cab. In the afternoons she goes to look after their daughter and three sons and he stays at the shop. Now Kefah has applied for a loan to enhance their shop by allowing them to obtain new snack stands and add more food products.

loans.use: obtain new snacks stands and add more food products.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 41-year-old mother of four sons. Her husband has recently retired from the military and is now working as a driver to be able to support his family. Amal helps in adding another source of income from selling baby pampers. Now she is applying for a loan to start selling detergents and cleaning products and to have variety in what she sells.

loans.use: to start selling detergents and cleaning products.

loans.name: Khairyah

texts.en: Khairyah is a 49-year-old widow who is looking after her 5 sons. From her tailoring business she was able to put food on the table for the family and pay for the household bills. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Sheela

texts.en:
Sheela is a 29-year-old differently-able lady living with her parents in the village of Balipatna in Odisha, India. She is engaged in the activity of making incense sticks, and she sells these sticks directly to the shopkeepers in the market. She started this business four years back when her family's economic condition was not good and her father was overburdened with family responsibility.

She has a plan to expand her business of making incense sticks by making them in large quantity and supplying them to the big dealers. She also wants to give training in making incense sticks to the girls of her village to make them self-employed.

She has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for purchasing glue, sticks, raw materials for covering the sticks, fragrance, wrapping bags, etc. She has a dream of running a training school for making incense sticks and supporting her father economically.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing glue, sticks, raw materials for covering the sticks, fragrance, wrapping bags etc. for her incense sticks business.

loans.name: Kabi Prasad

texts.en:
Kabi Prasad is a 28-year-old differently-able person living with his uncle and aunt in a small village named Balipatna of Odisha, India. He owns and manages a variety cum betel store, and he has this shop for the past four years. He sells biscuits, hair oil, biscuits, toothbrushes, betel, tobacco, incense sticks, talcum powder, chocolates and other daily household consumables in his shop. 

He has a plan to expand his business by adding more stock of what he sells and a few new products like detergents, soap, hair oil, shampoo, wafers, etc. to his shop inventory. He says that doing so will help him increase his monthly income and fulfill his family's daily requirements.

Kabi Prasad has applied for a loan amount of 30,000 INR for purchasing the above-mentioned items.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing detergents, soap, hair oil, shampoo, wafers etc. for his variety store.

loans.name: Hemanta Ku

texts.en:
Hemanta Ku is a 38-year-old differently-able person living with his wife and a child in a village of Khurda District in Odisha, India. He is engaged in the activity of selling milk and milk products in his village and the market near his village. He has three cows in his dairy farm. He has 10 years of experience in this business.

He has a plan to purchase one more cow and renovate the shed for his cattle. This would help him in generating more income and make his family financially strong.

Hemanta Ku has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing one more cow and renovating the shed for his cattle. He has a dream to let his child study in a good school and save some money for his family's future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing one more cow and to renovate the shed for his cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase tree farm supplies such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 42-year-old mother of three boys and a daughter. Ibtisam has a home business selling clothes and home products and appliances. Recently she added shelves to help her organize the goods she has. Now she is applying for a loan to increase the quantity and add selling cosmetics and make up products.

loans.use: to add selling cosmetics and make up products to her business.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai, 38 years old, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. His wife helps to support their family through the income she earns from working as a bookkeeper. Tai is a barber and began his barber's shop twelve years ago. They all live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Tai intends to take a loan to buy barber's tools and equipment, such as dryers and razors. The additional tools will enable him to increase his sales. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy barber's tools and equipment, such as dryers and razors

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 40, is divorced and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh city. 

Nga has been running a general store in front of her house for three years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different products such as cooking oils and soft drinks to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more different products such as cooking oils and soft drinks to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana Margarita de 38 años de edad habita junto a su familia. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable con su trabajo. Actualmente posee una tortillería ya que con esfuerzo sea superado ante las adversidades que la vida le ha presentado y gracias a ellos e su hogar nunca ha faltado el pan de cada día. Ana desea ampliar más su negocio es decir comprar mas suministros que le permitan tener su negocio mas rentable es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un prestamos para comprar maíz, aceite, manteca entre otros para que los clientes queden satisfechos y siempre mantenga esa clientela que tiene. Ella espera que la ayuda sea recibida y que pronto su calidad de vida mejore con forme vayan pasando los días.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita is 38 years old and lives with her family.  She is a hardworking and honest woman who is responsible with her work.  Currently she has a tortilla business.  She has overcome adversities in life with effort and thanks to them, her household has never gone without its daily bread.  

Ana wants to expand her business and purchase more supplies that will allow her to have a more profitable business.  This is why she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase corn, oil, butter, and other items.  She wants her customers to stay satisfied and always maintain the customers she has.  She hopes that she will receive help and that soon her quality of life will improve as time goes on.

loans.use: to purchase corn, oil, butter, and other items.

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh is 52 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in a small house, in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a laborer in a nearby company. Trinh runs a business of selling rices, to earn a living. 

She started her business 22 years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different kinds of rices, to resell to her customers. Trinh hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different kinds of rices, to resell to her customers

loans.name: Primas De Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAS DE HUAYNA POTOSI”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Irene es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de colchones, venta de canastas, compra y venta de ganado, venta de trenzas, venta de café y api.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Irene es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía (elaboración de canastas); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace 47 años y en la actualidad lo sigue realizando como fuente de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de plantas para el trenzado) que adquirirá de las comunidades cercanas al Lago Titicaca y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Primas de Huayna Potosi community bank will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office.  The group has six members and is headed by a board where Irene is the president.  The members of the group do different types of work: making mattresses, selling baskets, purchase and sales of livestock, sale of braids, and sale of coffee and apí [non-alcoholic maize drink]. 

The loan they are requesting will benefit small businesses like Irene's.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year and joined by invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a craft business making baskets.  She learned this business from her parents 47 years ago and continues to do it as her work.  

Irene will use the loan they are requesting to purchase plants to braid baskets.  She will purchase the plants in communities close to Lake Titicaca and later make the baskets to sell at her permanent sales location.  This type of work allows her to earn enough income to support her household.  She is married and has five children.

Irene says that the thing she likes best about Pro Mujer is the savings.

loans.use: to purchase plants to braid baskets.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 48, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh city. Her husband earns a living working as a driver.

Thanh has been running a general store and food stall in front of her house for three years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different products such as milk, confectionery items, dishes and spoons to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more different products such as milk, confectionery items, dishes and spoons to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Hermín Vladimir

texts.es:
Hermín es un joven emprendedor de 26 años de edad, que sueña con poder llegar a convertirse en un gran abogado, Su familia es de origen campesina y de un estrato socioeconómico bajo, por lo cual su sueño ingresar a la universidad se truncó y se vio en la necesidad de laborar para comenzar su carrera. 
En la actualidad trabaja diariamente de cuatro de la mañana a dos de la tarde como independiente, produce mazamorra, la cual prepara desde su casa y comercializa en los diferentes barrios del municipio de Santa Bárbara, Colombia.
Con el propósito de continuar con su gran sueño este joven se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de canecas para el transporte de su producto y compra de maíz para aumentar su producción. Espera que su situación económica mejore y poder brindarle una estabilidad económica a sus padres.
texts.en:
Hermín is a young entrepreneur who is 26 years old, and dreams of being able to become a great lawyer. His has a family of farmers and a low socioeconomic status, which is why his dream to enter the university has been spoiled and he sees the need to work in order to begin his career. Now he works daily from four in the morning until two in the afternoon as an independent salesperson. He produces mazamorra, a corn and milk pudding, which he prepares in his house and sells in different neighborhoods in the Santa Bárbara municipality of Colombia.

With the goal of continuing with his big dream, this young person is asking for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of large pots to transport his product in, as well as the purchase of corn to increase his production. He hopes that his economic situation will improve and be able to provide economic stability to his parents.

loans.use: to purchase large pots to prepare mazamorra (a type of pudding) and corn

loans.name: Jaime Ramiro

texts.es:
Jaime de 63 años de edad, ha dedicado gran parte de  su vida a comerciar. Desde hace 18 años montó su propio negocio en donde comercializa productos de la canasta familiar. Esta actividad ha sido su entrada económica para el y la familia de su hermana con la que trabaja en la tienda. 
Con esta actividad ha podido construir su casa y ofrecerle a su familia un techo para vivir. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de solventar la demanda de productos exigidos por su clientela. 
Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su empresa y convertirla en un mercado autoservicio, que permita mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 63 years old.  He has dedicated a large part of his life to sales.  Since he was 18, he has had his own business where he sells household items.  This work has been the financial ticket for him and his sister's family, with whom he works in the store.  This work has allowed him to build his house and offer his family a place to live.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase stock to meet his customer's demand for products.  

His dream is to see his business grow and become a self-service market, which will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase household items.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en: Kefah is a 39-year-old, divorced woman. She is a farmer who sells blankets at home, after work, to be able to support herself. She is applying for a loan to increase the quantity she has of blankets and bed covers, to increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of blankets and bed covers, available for sale

loans.name: Grupo 25 Gb Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GRUPO 25 GB”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Brígida es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pipocas y ropa, venta de artefactos electrónicos, venta de ropa americana, tienda de abarrotes, venta de productos AVON, salón de belleza, venta de peluches.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Brígida es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió después de haber estudiado esta técnica de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de secadora y cepillos) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará es su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal association "Grupo 25 GB" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as a parte of the Focal Center of Germán Busch. It is made of 8 partners and is directed by a board where Brígida is the president. The businesses that the partners of the association complete are varied. Some of them are the sale of popcorn and clothes, electronics, American clothes, groceries, Avon products, beauty salons, and stuffed animals.

The loan which will finance these microentrepreneurs . As a partner, Brígida notes that it's the first time they have worked with Pro Mujer, entering by the invitation of her sister who is a partner of the institution. Now she has a beauty salon business which she began after having studied the work technique.

The loan they will take out is to increase capital (to buy a hairdryer and brushes) which they will acquire in the markets of the town El Alto and afterwards she will install it in her workspace. This form of work allows her to generate more resources to maintain her family now that she is married and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys their lessons on health and credit.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and brushes

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan, age 27, is single and lives with her family in the city of Ho Chi Minh. She earns money by running a general store in front of her house. 

Ngan started this business three years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan so she can buy food and beverages to stock her store. This will enable her to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and that it will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Amazonas De Huayna Potosi Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAZONAS DE HUAYNA POTOSI II”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, venta de chompas, venta de celulares, venta de zapatos, macramé de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de chompas, venta de ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas de su grupo que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas a macramé; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió de hace años de su Tía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito; además nuestro servicio de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Amazonas de Huayna Potosi II” is starting its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Virginia is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different business activities such as weaving blankets, selling sweaters, selling mobile phones, selling shoes, producing macramé blankets, selling clothes, and selling hardware goods.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs such as Sra. Virginia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago after receiving an invitation from her friends in the group who are also members of the organization. At the moment, she has a business of producing macramé blankets. Virginia started this business years ago with her aunt.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool, which she acquires at the fairs in the city of El Alto. Afterwards, she uses these supplies to produce the goods that are sold to order. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Virginia is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Virginia said that she enjoys the training seminars related to health and credit issues. She also enjoys the health services provided by Pro Mujer.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Dora Morena

texts.es: Dora de 51 años de edad, vive junto a su familia sus dos hijos, Uno de ellos es especial. Gracias a Dios viven en casa propia ya que con esfuerzo han hecho que poco a poco su calidad de vida mejore un poco más. Dora es una mujer luchadora que sus visiones siempre han sido  darlo todo por el bienestar de sus hijos es responsable, honesta, sincera y trabajadora es muy amable y eso a ella le llena de orgullo ser una buena madre. Dora posee una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos básicos y de primera necesidad como leche, huevos, papel higiénico u otros. La tienda está ubicada en su casa y gracias a la manera de atender a los clientes ella posee de clientela quienes son los que la buscan para comprarles productos a diario. Lastimosamente  ella no tiene el capital necesario para hacer que su tienda crezca un poco y es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como: Sopas, café, maíz, frijol, Huevos, leche, pan dulce, chocolate u otros. La clienta cuenta con buenas referencias de pago y eso la hace que las personas depositen su confianza en ella, Confía en que Dios no la va a dejar sola y la ayuda pronto será entregada.
texts.en: Dora is 51 years old and lives together with her family and her two children, one of whom is in special education. She thanks God that they live in their own house now that they have made an effort to improve the quality of their lives little by little. Dora is a fighter whose vision has always been to give everything for the well-being of her children. She is responsible, honest, sincere, a hard worker, very friendly, and filled with pride for being a good mother. Dora has a small shop where she sells basic products and necessities like milk, eggs, toilet paper, and others. The store is located in her house and thanks to her manner of working with the clients, she has a clientele that comes to her looking to buy products every day. Unfortunately, she does not have the necessary capital to make her store grow a little, and for this reason she is asking Integral for a loan to purchase more basic materials like soups, coffees, corn, beans, eggs, milk, sweet bread, chocolate, and others. The client has good references for pay and that makes people leave her loans with confidence. She has faith that God is not going to leave her alone and that soon help will be delivered.

loans.use: to buy more basic materials like soups, coffees, corn, beans, eggs, milk, sweet bread, chocolate, and others.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Las Azucenas” que conforman 09 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 28. Julia tiene 36 años, casada con 07 hijos de la cual 03 de ellos en etapa escolar. Julia se dedica hace 20 años a la confección de ropa nueva y cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Julia ha solicitado el préstamo para la compra de hilos, agujas, tela, botones. Una de las metas de Julia es poder arreglar su casa para que sus hijos tengan mejor calidad de vida. Julia está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Kiva. Julia se encuentra ubicada en la parte de atrás es la tercera del lado derecho, viste polo negro.
texts.en: This is the group "Las Azucenas" (The White Lillies) which is made of nine partners who dedicate themselves to commercial activity and are passing through their 28th cycle. Julia is 36 years old, married with 7 children, three of whom are school aged. She has dedicated herself to making new clothing for the last 20 years and has loyal customers. Julia has asked for a loan to purchase thread, needles, cloth, and buttons. One of Julia's goals is to be able to fix her house so that her children can have a better quality of life. Julia is very content with this loan and grateful to Kiva. Julia is located in the back and is the third from the right side, seen in the black shirt.

loans.use: to purchase threads, needles, cloth, and buttons.

loans.name: Marlina Stephany

texts.es:
Marlina, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por las facilidades de la institución, además de que este aporte le ayuda para mejorar el negocio, se comprara lociones, cremas, shampoo, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio.
Ella manifiesta que su efecto con el crédito anterior fue positivo, le ayudo a mejorar en los ingresos, ha mejorado su nivel de ingresos.
texts.en:
Marlina decided on a new loan due to the institution's easy plan. In addition to the fact that this loan will help her improve her business in purchasing lotions, creams, and shampoo, these purchases will help her to improve the selection in her business.

She says that her experience with the previous loan was positive, as it helped her to improve her earnings and has improved the level of her earnings.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams and shampoo.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 24 year old single man.  He was not fortune enough to find a suitable job after getting his bachelors degree.  Since he has two younger sisters  to look after, he opened a small restaurant.  The restaurant will help the family earn income and allows Rami to switch jobs in the future.  

Rami works in his restaurant, which serves local food and sandwiches such as hummus and falafel.  He applied for a youth loan to buy new pots and ingredients.  He hopes that adding new dishes to the menu will enhance his business.

loans.use: to buy new pots and ingredients.

loans.name: Mwale Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her late 30s, is a married mother of three children. She has one son and two daughters, all of whom go to school.  She has been running a pub for three years now.  She works from 3 p.m. to midnight. She is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Pili's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more beverages such as beer and sodas. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy more spirits and to renovate her pub. She dreams of buying another pikipiki (motorbike). 

Pili will share this loan with her loan group "Mwale," which has 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more spirits and to renovate her pub.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen would like to take another loan to buy ingredients to make cakes to sell in her store. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Yen believes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business. This will enable her to attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cakes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es: Maria de 50 años de edad habita junto a su hijo en casa propia, Es una mujer que toda la vida ha trabajado con buenas aspiraciones, siendo muy emprendedora y trabajadora, siempre toda la vida se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer que ha dado la vida por sus hijo que siempre ha sido su mayor fuente de inspiracion. Maria tiene una pequeña tortilleria ubicada en su hogar y gracias a Dios tiene clientes quienes la prefienren ya que maneja precios accesibles y esmuy amable a la hora de vender. Maria desea inventir en la compra de insumos necesarios para seguir teniendo su tortilleria por eso ha solicitado a INTEGRAL un prestamo para comprar maiz, leña, mannteca, aceite, volteadores etc. Y confia en Dios que su credito llegara y seguira dandole la oportunidad de tener una buena vida a ella y su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years of age, and lives with her son in her own house. She has worked all her life with high hopes for the future, and is entrepreneurial and hard-working. Throughout her life she has always given everything to provide for her son, who has been her biggest source of inspiration. 

Maria has a small tortilla business in her home, and thankfully she has customers who choose to buy from her due to her affordable prices and friendliness when selling her goods. Maria wants to buy the supplies she needs to keep her tortilla business going, and has therefore requested a loan from INTEGRAL to buy corn, firewood, lard, oil, tortilla-making utensils, etc. She places her trust in God that she will receive her loan, and will continue to ensure that she and her son have the opportunity to have a good life.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, lard, oil, tortilla-making utensils, etc.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is a 53 year old married woman.  She lives with her six children, five sons and a daughter, and husband in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband earns money as a driver for hire.  For twenty years, she has run a grocery store, selling vegetables to people in her community.

Hai would like a loan to purchase better quality vegetables at competitive prices from wholesalers.  She hopes that this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family may face.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosas De Bautista Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE BAUTISTA”  iniciará el vigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valeria es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de miniaturas, trenzado de mantas, venta de utensilios, venta de donas y masitas,  lavado de autos, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, taller de calzados, venta de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Valeria es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de material escolar; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que ella vende este mismo material.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuadernos, lápices, reglas, estuches, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito y las reuniones con las amigas.
texts.en:
The group ROSES BAUTISTA (Roses of Bautista) will begin their twenty-sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Pan American Focal Center. It consists of nine members and is directed by a board where Valeria is the Treasurer. The members of the community association conduct diverse businesses such as: selling miniatures, braided rugs, selling utensils, selling donuts and pastries, washing cars, selling clothing, corner store, cobbler, selling shoes.

The loan will benefit small businesses of which Valeria is a member. She joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling school supplies; she tells us that she learned the business from her mother, who sells the same things.
 
The loan she is requesting will go toward increasing capital (to buy notebooks, pencils, rulers, pencil cases, etc..) which she will acquire at the fairs in La Paz and then sell at her stand. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as she lives in a common-law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the credit and health training and meetings with friends.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, rulers, pencil cases, etc.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is 35 years old and is single.  He lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

He has run a general store at his house for the past 10 years.  He sells milk, beverages, stationery, and confectionery.  He intends to use his loan to buy a variety of products to sell, including eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him improve his living conditions and save money for future business investments.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell at his general store.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and in increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is asking for a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and drinks, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her better meet the needs of her customers. Her last loan allowed her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that this new loan will help her increase the size of her store and increase sales and will also help her improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and drinks, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Gai would like to take out a further loan to buy coffee and drinks to sell from her house. She also would like to buy more chickens, ducklings, and frogs to raise and sell. Gai's last loan allowed her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee and drinks to sell as well as chickens, ducklings, and frogs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh would like to take out another loan to buy beauty products to sell to her customers. Her last loan allowed her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of beauty products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en: Ngan would like to take out another loan to buy construction materials to stock in her store. Her last loan allowed her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to stock in her store.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is a 21-year-old, young provider of the family. He takes care of his mother, brother, and sister. Elnur's father has died and his teeny sister receives a pension from his father's job place until she will graduate. 

To improve family living conditions, he changed his plans about his own future and, four years ago, he started carpenter work. He is engaged in the manufacture of doors and windows. His brother is assisting him at the workshop he has rented. 

Elnur is a hard-working man and there are less difficulties at his work now. His desire is to take new and modern instruments and use them to produce high-quality service.

The reason Elnur has applied for the loan is to buy wooden materials to make the windows for their house. The windows are rotten now and keep the house cold in winter. He will make the windows himself at his workshop.

loans.use: to buy wooden materials to make the windows for their house.

loans.name: Maria Del Trancito

texts.es: Maria de 51 años de edad habita en casa propia junto con esposo y su  hijo. Su esposo trabaja como motorista cerca de su vivienda y ella  posee una tiendita en la cual vende diversidad de artículos tales como: arroz, frijoles, golosinas,  azúcar, aceite, detergente, etc. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación a logrado mantenerlo activo por todo este tiempo. Cabe destacar que no tiene un trabajo fijo y se dedica a cuidar y atender en la tienda.  Ella se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora  y responsable ya que las metas que se propone siempre las alcanza con mucho éxito. Su sueño es ver su negocio florecer y lograr mejorar sus ingresos con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. De acuerdo a lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeña tiendita en la compra de mercadería  como: golosinas, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, detergente, café, leche, etc. De tal forma que su tienda siempre tenga todo lo que los clientes buscan y así poder alcanzar su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 51 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and child. Her husband works as a driver near their home and Maria has a small shop through which they sell diverse products such as rice, beans, sweets, sugar, oil, detergent, etc. She has spent many years dedicating herself to the business and thanks to God and her dedication she has managed to keep the business active for all of this time. It should be noted that she doesn't have fixed work and dedicates herself to caring for her store. She is characterized by being a very hard worker and above all as very enterprising and responsible now that the goals she has proposed have given her a lot of success. Her dream is to see the business flourish and to manage to improve hear earnings with the objective of improving the quality of life for herself and for her family. Due to the above, she has decided to ask for this loan from Integral to invest in her little shop for the purchase of merchandise such as sweets, sugar, rice, beans, detergent, coffee, milk, etc. In this war, her shop always has all of the products her clients seek and thus she can achieve her dream of improving the quality of her and her family's lives.

loans.use: compra de mercadería  como: golosinas, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, detergente, café, leche, etc.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.ru:
Самвел родился и живет  в городе Капан ,Сюникской области. У Самвела высшее инженерное образование,он окончил Ереванский Политехнический институт,факультет Кибернетики. После учебы он долгие годы работал инженером в Капане. 
С 2002 года  Самвел начал заниматся производством строительных материалов.
Уже 10 лет как Самвел арендовал строительное  помешение  в Капане и производит разные бетоные плитки для тратуаров. Во время многочисленных заказов Самвелу помагают родные и близкие. 
Самвелу 53 года.Он женат и имеет двух сыновей. С прибылью от его производства Самвел содержит семью, платит за учебу сына и помогает родителям пенсионерам. 
Самвелу нужен кредит на сумму 300,000 Армянских драм для приобритения цемента и песка. Кредит поможет ему во время выполнить большой заказ Областного муниципалитета.Эта сделка принесет ему крупный  доход.
texts.en:
Samvel was born and raised in Kapan, in the Syunik region. He graduated the State Engineering University of Armenia with a degree in cybernetics and later worked as an engineer in Kapan for many years. In 2002, he started a business producing construction materials. For 10 years, he's rented a building in Kapan where he makes various concrete paving stones used in sidewalks. His family helps him run the business.

Samvel is 53 years old. He's married and he has two children. His business enables him to provide for his family, pay for his son's education and support his own pensioner parents. 

Samvel is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to purchase cement and sand. These materials will allow him to fulfill a very profitable large order placed by the regional municipality.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand for his manufacturing

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang, 33, is divorced and has two children.  She lives with her sons in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hang started a food stall five years ago.  She sells food, such as noodles and pork, to people in her community.  She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food and furniture for her stall.  She hopes her business runs smoothly and will allow her to generate a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and furniture for her food stall.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.  This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers.  Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increasing sales, and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single mother with five children, only two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (two brothers and one sister). She has run a business selling local gin for five years. She works from her house and sells wholesale only, seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more jerrycans of gin. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She hopes to build a store to house jerrycans of gin and also to build rental rooms. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more local gin.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 28 years old and lives in the Gori District with his wife and 3 children.  Besik requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times, for a start-up business, without any success.  His loan requests were rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays the family has no source of income.  According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the ‘subsistence poor’ category.  Besik requested a loan from Credo to start a family business.  His loan request was approved as part of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages the provision of credit to country rural poor with soft conditions, as they are considered “high risk borrowers” and do not have access to credit products.

With this loan, Besik will purchase pigs to resell at a higher price in order to increase the family’s income.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 46 years old. She is a single mother of two children. She sells vegetables in Kiambu and has been in this business for 11 years now. She gets a monthly income of KES 60,000 (sixty thousand shillings).

This will be Jane's seventh loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). She plans to use the entire loan to pay school fees for her children. She wants to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Baddy

texts.es:
Baddy, de 27 años. Es un hijo responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres y sus 2 hermanas, en su casa propia desde que nació. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en el bordado de chalecos de Huaylas, principal danza típica de la región. Gracias a su habilidad en el bordado, tiene muchos pedidos de manera semanas, ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en este negocio. Pero la habilidad lo adquirió desde niño, pues sus padres le enseñaron el oficio familiar. En esta fecha tiene muchos pedidos por lo que tendrá que trabajar al doble, “tengo que aprovechar al máximo, ya que las ganancias son buenas”, comenta. Paralelo a su trabajo se dedica a la construcción, ahora tiene que techar y remodelar una escuela de la ciudad. Los planes de Baddy, son mejorar sus ingresos para ayudar a sus hermanas, a las que quiere pagar sus estudios de la universidad. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “mollecito” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota.
Baddy, invertirá el dinero en la compra de telas por mayor para los bordados
texts.en:
Twenty-seven year old Baddy is a responsible young man and has lived in the same family-owned house all his life, along with his parents and two sisters.  Baddy's main income comes from sewing vests for "Huayla", a typical dance in the region.  Thanks to his talents in embroidery, he receives many orders every week and he now has three years experience in this business.  However, he learned this skill as a child, when his parents taught him this family trade.  He currently has many orders and is having to work twice as much: "I have to take full advantage as I am earning good money", he says.  In addition to this work, Baddy also works as a builder and he is currently replacing the roof of and renovating one of the city's schools.  Baddy plans are to improve his income to help his sisters - he wants to pay for their university studies.  Baddy belongs to the "Mollecito" solidarity group and this is his second loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he will have financial support as that way he will feel secure as he progresses with his business.  He also promises to make his repayments on time.

Baddy will invest the money in buying material in bulk for embroidery.

loans.use: to buy material in bulk for embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat, and flour for his shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 60-year-old, single woman with two children >18yrs old.  She sells ready-cooked food and soft drinks in Kiambu.  She has been in this business for 10 years and makes a monthly income of 60,000 shillings.

Mary plans to use this loan to buy soft drinks, sugar, and cooking oil in bulk.  In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sadashib

texts.en:
Sadashib is a 37-year-old physically challenged person. He lives with his parents, wife and a child who is schooling. 

Sadashib owns and manages a small grocery store in his village. He sells food items like rice, lentils, pickles, salt, onions, potatoes, spices, etc. He has to travel every three days to the nearest market in Nayagarh to get more stock. 

He wants to reinvest in his grocery store, so that he can stock up more inventory at his shop to meet the demand of the local people and reduce his transportation and buying costs. This will increase Sadashib’s earning capacity.

Sadashib has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase more items of what he is selling right now, add more variety to his product line, add more stock of goods to his grocery shop, and grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, lentils, pickles, salt, onions, potatoes, spices, etc. for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Twende Mbele A Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth’s group has 14 farmers and is located in the Bungoma South District.  Elizabeth is pictured on the right with her hand raised.  She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize.  Elizabeth first enrolled with the One Acre Fund during the 2011 “long rains” season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 season.  Elizabeth joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize per 2 acres.  But after joining One Acre Fund during the long rains of 2012, she was able to harvest 10 bags per ½ acre.  She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to buy clothing for herself and the family.  During the 2013 long rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit.  Elizabeth’s group will receive 7 acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo in a yellow T-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Hector De Jesús

texts.es:
Hector de 54 años de edad, es de procedencia campesina, oficio que heredó de sus padres. Toda su vida ha laborado en la agricultura y desde hace seis años alterna su oficio con la cría y levante de pollos de engorde, los cuales comercializa en su municipio en tiendas y supermercados. Gracias a esta actividad su condición de vida ha mejorado considerablemente. Su mayor sueño es ampliar sus galpones y tener gallinas ponedoras para convertirse en el mayor distribuidor de huevos en su municipio, pero es conciente que este será un proyecto a mediano plazo.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos de levante, con el fin de aumentar su capacidad de producción y mejorar sus ingresos para garantizarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y comenzar a materializar su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Hector is 54 years old and comes from an agricultural background which he inherited from his parents. All of his life he has worked in agriculture, and for six years he has been breeding and raising chickens, which he sells in local shops and markets. Thanks to this business his living conditions have improved considerably. His greatest dream is to expand his coops and breed laying hens in order to become the biggest distributor of eggs in the region, though he knows this is a longer-term goal. 

Currently he is soliciting a loan in order to purchase broiler chickens, with the end goal of increasing his production capacity and improving his income so he can guarantee a better quality of life for his family and begin to realize his dream.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 21 años, es una madre soltera, tiene una pequeña hija llamada Verónica. Vive en compañía de sus padres en su casa propia, desde que nació. La confección de faldas típicas, es su principal ingreso económico. Sus padres desde muy pequeña le enseñaron el oficio familiar. Ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en la fabricación de manera independiente. En todo este tiempo logró obtener una maquina industrial, gracias a su esfuerzo. Su trabajo consiste en pedidos de faldas típicas, “tengo mayor ingreso económico con los bordados de faldas a mano, me tardo un promedio de un mes y logro ganar mil soles promedio, por falda”, comenta. Ahora comenzó la temporada festiva de Santiago, (fiesta en honor a los animales), donde tiene muchos pedidos de faldas para que bailen los pobladores en la festividad, por lo que contrató a su tía para que le ayude, espera obtener buenas ganancias. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mollecito” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Elizabeth, invertirá el dinero en la compra de hilos y telas al por mayor para sus bordados.
texts.en: Elizabeth, 21, is a single mother.  She and her young daughter, Veronica, live with her parents in the house where she grew up.  She owns a sewing business that is now her main source of income.  Her parents taught her to sew when she was growing up, tailoring having been something of a family business.  Elizabeth started the business 3 years ago and quickly managed to buy an industrial-scale sewing machine of her own.  She mostly makes traditional skirts.  "I make most of my income from hand-embroidering skirts . . . they take a month to make and I earn an average of one-thousand soles per skirt", she says.  The Festival of Santiago (patron saint of animals) starts soon and Elizabeth expects many orders for skirts because local women want them for dances scheduled during the festival.  So many orders, in fact, that she plans to hire her aunt to help her.  Elizabeth belongs to the "Mollecito" community bank and this will be her second MFP loan.  She likes the support she receives from the bank and says it will help her to ensure the success of her business.  She, in turn, is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.  She will use the loan to buy wholesale supplies of fabric and thread for her business.
