loans.use: to buy supplies for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Magela De Jesus

texts.es: Magela, casada, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería, estudio Relaciones Internacionales, originaria de la ciudad de León. Inicio su negocio con ayuda de su mama, sus primeros productos fueron verduras, gaseosas, el cual le ayudo a pagar su carrera universitaria. Actualmente sobrevive gracias a la pulpería pues la crisis económica y la escasez de trabajo no le han permitido desarrollarse en el campo profesional. Pero esto no la desmotivo a salir adelante y seguir con su negocio buscando como mejorarlo cada día. Ella solicita el financiamiento para comprar  jugos, gaseosas, agua embotellada, verduras y frutas. Su expectativa es invertir en la compra de nuevos y mejores productos para surtir su pulpería y lograr convertirla en una distribuidora de productos variados para el hogar.
texts.en:
Magela is married, works as a retailer, and owns a small grocery store. She studied international relations, and comes from the city of León. Magela started her business with her mother’s help, and the first products she sold were sodas. This helped her to pay for her university degree. She now gets by thanks to her grocery store, as the financial crisis and lack of work have meant that she was unable to continue with her professional career. However, this did not discourage her from getting ahead in life and continuing with her business, and she is constantly looking for ways to improve it. 

Magela has requested this financing to buy juices, sodas, bottled water, vegetables and fruit. She plans to invest the money in the purchase of new and improved products to supply her grocery store, turning it into a distribution point for various products for the home.

loans.use: To buy juices, sodas, bottled water, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Sushant Kumar

texts.en:
Sushant Kumar is a 26-year-old differently abled person living with his parents in a small village of Nayagarh district in Odisha, India. He owns and manages a small variety store where he sells biscuits, hair oil, mosquito repellents, deodorant, talc, wafers, etc. 

Sushant Kumar wants to enhance his business by adding more stock of what he sells; also a few more new varieties of products like electric bulbs, soda, chocolates, pickles, toothbrushes, etc., for which he has applied for a loan of 25,000 INR. He says that doing so will increase his monthly income and his family's economic status.

Sushant Kumar has a dream to give a quality life to his parents and save some money for his future.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, hair oil, mosquito repellents, deodorant, talc, wafers, etc. for his variety store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married, with three children. Two of her children go to school. She has a drug clinic and has been in this business for ten years. 

She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000/= (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more boxes of syrups and tablets.  

Mary works in a shop that she rents. She sells on a retail basis, seven days out of every week. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include seasonality, taxes, and defaulters. 

She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked clinic and also build a rental house which will house the clinic. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of syrups and tablets for her clinic.

loans.name: Upendo Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Nuru, who is in her mid-40s, is married with two sons, one of whom goes to school. The other one is small.  

Nuru has been selling fried chicken and fish for two years now. She works from 11:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Nuru's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy more fish and chicken, and covered household expenses. She has paid back her loan successfully.  She will use this loan to buy more chicken and fish to fry and sell. Her dream is to one day be able to own a hotel.

Nuru will share this loan with her loan group, "Upendo Kigogo", with 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, de 50 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Armando, su esposo desde hace 23 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con una de ellas Karina a la que apoyan en su casa propia, que adquirió hace 30 años.

Ella cuida de su nieto mientras pueda pues su hija trabaja. Su principal actividad económica es la confección de mandiles típicos que las mujeres utilizan como vestimenta diaria, le va muy bien en su trabaja tanto así que viaja a las diferentes ciudades para venderlas por unidad, ya que de esa manera puede obtener mayores ganancias, pero en festividades realiza por mayor ya que recibe pedidos. Además se dedica a la compra y venta de menestras, las cuales lleva al mercado mayorista por cantidad, ahí obtiene un dinero extra. Por su parte su esposo trabaja en el trasporte público con un ómnibus que adquirió gracias a su esfuerzo, la cual le sirve para trasladar a los pobladores de la ciudad de Cochas hacía el centro de Huancayo. Ella se siente muy feliz, pues sus hijos mayores le mandan constantemente una mensualidad, gusta de verlos desarrollados.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mollecito” y este es el crédito número 11 con MFP, donde está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota.
Antonia; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales para realizar los mandiles, como hilos y telas de diversos colores.
texts.en:
Antonia, who is 50 years old, is a hard working woman. She lives with Armando, her husband for the past 23 years. They have 4 children, but only one, Karina, lives with them. They support her in their own home, which Antonia got 30 years ago.

She minds her grandchild while she can, as her daughter works. Her main economic activity is making traditional aprons that the women use for everyday wear.  Her work is going very well, so much so that she travels to the different cities around to sell the aprons by the unit. This way gives her higher profits. However, during festivals she sells the aprons in bulk as she receives orders for them. She also buys and sells dried vegetables. She sells these at the wholesale market. This gives her some extra money. 

For his part, her husband works in public transport with a bus that he acquired thanks to her work. He transports the residents of city of Cochas to the centre of Huancayo. She is very happy as her older children always send her a monthly allowance. She is delighted to see them doing well. She is a member of the solidarity group called “Mollecito” and this is the 11th loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she will have financial support and feels sure that her business will progress.  She also promises to make her payments.

Antonia will invest the money requested to buy materials to make aprons, such as thread and different coloured fabric.

loans.use: to buy materials to make aprons, such as thread and different coloured fabric

loans.name: Lesbia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lesbia de  44 años de edad, casada con hijos mayores de edad, e independiente, originaria del departamento de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta cocinar comida típica para su familia como gallo pinto, nacatamales comida propia de la región. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económico lo cual la obligo a trabajar a temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica destace y venta de la carne elaborada con el cerdo. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Actividad que la desempeña los fines de  semana cuando existen mayor demanda de dicho productos, productos como nacatamales, chicharrón, yuca, moronga, carde cerdo, chancho frito, chicharon blanco. Tiene 23 años tener el negocio. En la foto se muestra con hojas donde se embuelve el nacatamal. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos para su posterior comercialización. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. Lesbia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Lesbia, 44, is married and has two grown children.  She grew up in the "departamento" of Leon in western Nicaragua.  In her spare time, she likes to cook for her family.  She makes traditional food: gallo pinto, nacatamales and other dishes common to this region.  Unfortunately, she had to leave school early because her family didn't have enough money for her to continue.  She had to go to work at a young age, instead, to help with family expenses.  Thanks to a strong spirit and a drive to get ahead, she was able to start her own pork-sales business.  She operates the business from her house and is especially busy on weekends when there's the most demand for her products from customers who buy what she sells to make nacatamales, chicharron, yucca, moronga, carde cerdo, chancho frito, chicharon blanco and other pork-based dishes.  She has operated the business for 23 years.  That's Lesbia, in the photo, with leaves that she uses to make nacatamales.  She will use this loan to stock her business with products that she sell later.  Lesbia likes her work very much and says that she is grateful to Kiva investors for their support.  Their loans, she says, make it possible for people with few resouces in poor countries like Nicaragua to make a decent living.

loans.use: to raise pigs for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase phone accessories to offer for sale

loans.name: Cruz Del Socorro

texts.es:
Cruz del Socorro, de  58 años de edad, soltera con siete hijos mayores de edad. Originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Cruz del Socorro se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable, en sus pagos, y lo ha demostrado en sus créditos anteriores en tiempo y forma. Ha sido una mujer muy luchadora la cual ha tenido que trabajar desde muy joven para ganarse el pan de cada día. Por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar solamente la educación primaria.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante, es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de cerdos y productos lácteos, desde hace  25 años. Negocio que lo tiene ubicado en un lugar especifico de su localidad. La rutina de Cruz es trabajar unas 8 horas diaria, ofreciendo sus productos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos el cual se lo están ofreciendo a un buen precio. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. Cruz del Socorro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Cruz del Socorro, is single and has seven grown children.  She grew up in the "departamento" of Leon in western Nicaragua.  She is a hard-working, responsible woman who has repaid past loans on time and in accordance with all terms and conditions.  She knows how to work hard because she's had to work hard all her life just to put food on the table.  She had to leave school early because her family didn't have enough money for her to continue.  
Cruz started her own pork- and milk-sales business 25 years ago, a business that she scraped together thanks to her great spirit and drive to get ahead.  She operates the business in the town.  She normally works 8 hours a day and says that she likes her work very much.  She will use this loan to buy pigs that she will resell at a better price.  She thinks the investment will help her to increase her income sooner rather than later.  Cruz is grateful to Kiva lenders and says that their loans make it possible for people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to make a decent living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Bong's Group

texts.en:
Bong was born in 1981. She has a little child. Her husband is an electricity worker. His income is 3,000,000 VND per month. Bong sews clothes to earn a living. She earns 5,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In this first loan, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy thread and buttons to do her job. 

Her dream is to allow her children to have good careers.

Other members which are part of Bong's group include the following: 
- Loc was born in 1979. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy food for chickens. 
- Them was born in 1978. She has two children. She sells groceries in the market. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy rice and dried food for her store. 
- Chat was born in 1972. She has two children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy for her animals. 
- Thoa was born in 1980. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy groceries to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy thread and buttons to do her job.

loans.name: Bayardo

texts.es: Bayardo es de la Comarca llamada San José de los Remates, en las afueras de Teustepe, casado, tiene 4 hijos, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles. El realiza esta actividad desde los  10 años ayudando a su  tío en la siembra,  debido a que su papa se fue de la casa, luego al casarse  el decide seguir con esta misma actividad de la siembra, del cual ha podido salir adelante con las ganancias que le genera su cosecha. Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar animales como (vaca) y a la misma vez comprar semilla de frijol y maíz.  El espera almacenar  bastantes granos básicos para vender  durante  la época de verano que es cuando empieza  a escasear el producto. Unos de sus proyectos es  comprar ganado y tierras para mejorar sus ingresos. Una de sus metas próximas es poner un centro venta de leche al por mayor.
texts.en:
Bayardo is from the region of San Jose de los Remates, on the outskirts of Teustepe. He is married and has four children, and is dedicated to the cultivation of corn and beans. 

He has been doing this for the last 10 years, helping his uncle with cultivation, because his father left them. Later, when Bayardo married, he decided to keep doing the same work, from which he has been able to get ahead with the income he makes from the harvest. 

He Is requesting a loan to buy animals (like a cow) and at the same time buy beans and corn seed. He hopes to store enough grains to sell during the summer which is when the product becomes scarce. One of his projects is to buy cattle and land to improve their income. One of his next goals is a central location to sell milk wholesale.

loans.use: to buy animals (like a cow) and at the same time, buy beans and corn seed.

loans.name: Lirio

texts.en:
Lirio, 22 years old, is married and has two children. She is from the village of Sto. Domingo, in a mountainous area. Most of the family's income comes from their farming business. Lirio has owned and run a general store for one year. She is thankful because her gained profits go to their daily necessities, the monthly electric bill and some family savings.

Lirio would like to increase the volume of her groceries, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy items such as sugar, eggs, soft drinks and soap for her general store. Lirio hopes that she will obtain this loan for her to gain better profit and to have a continuous smooth flow of business.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, eggs, soft drinks and soap

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Radhika, 29 years old, lives in Balirampur Village Development Committee of Bara District with her husband, two daughters and two sons. Both Radhika and her husband are actively involved in a farming business. They have a thresher machine which they use to earn money by threshing fellow farmers' paddies and wheat.

Radhika has requested a loan amount of NPR 60,000 to buy another threshing machine so that she can expand her business. Her long association with Nirdhan Utthan bank has helped her to buy some land from the proceeds of her threshing business. She has faced hardship in earlier days. Now she is happy due to the performance of the business.

loans.use: to purchase a threshing machine

loans.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Esta is in her mid-30’s and married with one child, who is currently in school.  She has been running two businesses for the past year (charcoal, fruits and vegetables).  She works from 8 AM to 8 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Esta's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy items (sacks of charcoal, fruits, vegetables), to pay school fees, and to cover household expenses.  She has repaid all of her loans successfully.  She will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal, fruits, and vegetables to sell. She dreams of becoming an international businesswoman.

Esta will share this loan with her loan group "Jitahidi Msakuzi".  Each of the group’s 15 members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal, fruits, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is 42 years old and married with 3 children.  She owns a kiosk where she sells everyday household staples like soap, shampoo, bread, milk, snacks, and other products.  She is a very hardworking lady who always desires to improve her position and to achieve her dreams.  She has been doing this for the last four years and that has given her enough experience and helped her to increase her profit margin.

She is requesting a 20,000 KSH loan from YEHU, where she has been a member for the last two years.  With this loan she will stock her business with wheat and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy wheat and maize flour for her food stall.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Ghanaian artisan Daniel specializes in hand-carved African masks and drums. He would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of wood, polish, sandpaper and glue to increase production.

Daniel has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story:

"I'm married, and I have four children but I also look after five other children. I had already worked in carpentry when my brother-in-law Samuel taught me the art of carving. I specialize in traditional masks and African drums, and I usually get a good response from people. However, due to financial constraints, I'm not able to produce enough to meet the demand. I love to create new designs, so I constantly work to diversify my collection. I have taught more than ten people how to carve, and they are also well-established in this trade.

"I thank the people involved in this microcredit. It will help me to continue carving the works you have favored."

Use the link below to view Daniel's hand-carved masks and drums on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6552

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of wood, polish, sandpaper and glue to increase production

loans.name: Made

texts.en:
Made is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted sterling silver and gemstone jewelry. He would like to stock up on the silver he uses to craft his jewelry.

Made has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:

"I recall how I learned the silversmith art from a family member. He taught me after school and at that time, the tools we used were still very traditional. I first learned to hammer silver by hand and sometimes I'd miss and hit my hand! When I was learning to place tiny silver granules, I'd fall asleep. But I was eventually able to craft earrings by myself. Then I learned to design my own items, and my dream is to see my jewelry worn by people around the world."

"I want to say thanks to all of you who help to fund this loan. I need it to buy silver so I can replenish the jewelry as it sells and develop a few new designs. Thank you for your support. I hope this will help me to grow little by little."

Use the link below to view Made's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7147

loans.use: to stock up on the silver he uses to craft his jewelry

loans.name: Yuni

texts.en:
Yuni is an artisan from Bali who specializes in batik art on silk. She would like to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of silk for her shawls and scarves.

Yuni has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

"I learned the art of batik from my mother when I was very young. She has been making batik at home in Java for over 23 years, while waiting each day for my father to come home from the sea. We still design together, especially the floral and bird motifs that are typical in Pekalongan batik. My husband Rieckey also helps me a lot, but as a  local Balinese woman, I'm very proud of the fact that I can have the career that I love and be able to provide for myself and my family.

"It means a lot to us that you support us through this microcredit. It will help us to keep on crafting your favorite shawls and scarves, as well as to try out new designs." 

Use the link below to view Yuni's silk batik items on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5981

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of larger amounts of silk for her shawls and scarves

loans.name: Fuente De Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FUENTE DE VIDA”  iniciará el vigésimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alejandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía en chompas, tienda de abarrotes, tejido a telares, tejido de chompas, venta de artefactos, venta de jugos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alejandra es integrante, ella indica que hace un 16 años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por  iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los consultorios médicos de la institución.
texts.en:
The FUENTA DE VIDA community bank is starting its twenty-fifth round of funding with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana.  The community bank has eight members and is led by a board headed by its president, Sra. Alejandra.  The members operate a range of businesses that include: clothes-making, grocery sales, cloth weaving, crafts sales and juice sales.  

This loan will benefit the small businesses of Sra. Alejandra and the community bank's other members.  Sra. Alejandra started working with Pro Mujer 16 years ago, after she was invited to join a community bank by a friend who was a member.  Now she has her own sweater-making business and she wants us to know that she learned the business on her own initiative.  
 
Sra. Alejandra will use this loan to buy wool for making sweaters.  She will buy the wool at a market in La Paz, cart it back to her town and use it to make sweaters.  The income that she will make from selling the sweaters will make it possible for her to support her family.  She is married and has three children. 

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes that she can arrange medical visits through the institution.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her textiles business.

loans.name: Savitri

texts.en:
Savitri is a 38-year-old woman from Balirampur Village Development Committee of Bara District. She is married to Shankar. For the last 10 years, Savitri has been involved in a business purchasing and selling grain. She goes to different villages, purchasing and selling good grains in the local market.

Savitri has requested a loan of NPR 20,000 with Nirdhan Uthhan Bank limited branch office to support her grain sales business. Savitri has good support from her husband in this business. They are happily married and have one son. This business has given Savitri respect in society and she is seen as an inspiring figure among the women fraternities in the village.

loans.use: to buy grains from villages to resell in the rural market

loans.name: Chamanpi Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHAMAMPI SARTASIÑANI”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mercadería de alasitas, tienda de barrio, venta de dulces y golosinas, venta de muebles, salón de belleza, tejidos, bordados computarizados, venta de comida

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mónica es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de todo tipo de prendas de vestir; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su esposo al iniciar su taller de costura.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el equipamiento de su taller (compra de máquina recta) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The CHAMAMPI SARTASINYANI community bank is starting its sixth round of funding with Proj Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de German Busch.  The community bank has eight members and is led by a board headed by Sra. Monica, its president.  The members operate a range of businesses that include: merchandise sales, a corner shop, snack sales, furniture sales, a beauty salon, cloth-weaving, computerized embroidering services and food sales.

This loan will benefit the small businesses of Sra. Monica and the community bank's other members.  Sra. Monica tells us that this is her second round of funding and that she was invited to join the community bank by a friend who is a member.  She operates a clothes-making business.  She makes all kinds of clothing and says that she started the business with her husband who also makes clothes.  
 
Sra. Monica will use this loan to buy a new sewing machine.  She will buy the machine at a market in El Alto and install it in her workshop.  The income that she will make from selling the sweaters will make it possible for her to support her family.  

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the health training and loans they provide..

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is married with seven children. Juvy is 48 years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Tangub City.

Juvy sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy more fish for the additional capital raised from selling fish.

Juvy has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of selling the fish and to became a fish dealer in her place.

loans.use: to buy more fish for the additional capital raised from selling fish

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn, 28 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. She lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Tangub City. For the past 5 years, Rosalyn has been selling fish, earning a monthly income of PHP 10,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy more fish to sell. Rosalyn has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using her profits to grow the business bigger and to achieve her business dreams.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Koraisha

texts.en:
Koraisha is a 36-year-old married women from Balirampur Village Development Committee of Bara District. She is married to Mr. Allamudin. 

Mrs. Koraisha and her husband have been in the business of selling food grain for the last seven years. Mrs. Koraisha goes to different villages and purchases paddy rice and pulses from the village people, and she sells the thus procured grain in the local market at higher prices.  She has requested a loan of NPR 40000.00 (forty thousand) from Nirdhan Utthan Bank, Ltd. branch office to support this ongoing business as a seventh loan. 

With the long association and transactions with Nirdhan Utthan Bank, Ltd., Mrs. Koraisha was able to buy some land in Balirampur Village out of the income from her food grain selling business, and she has been able to educate her son to secondary level. They have earned good local respect in the area where they operate their business.

loans.use: to buy food grain like paddy rice and wheat from the villages to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 60 years old and married. Angelina works very hard to provide a living.

Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  Angelina has been in this business for four years, and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Angelina would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un agricultor muy  emprendedor y con grandes deseos de superación, cultiva  maíz y frijoles a los cuales necesita darle mantenimiento con fungicidas,  insecticidas y abonos, y es para la compra de estos suministros y semillas de estos granos  que está solicitando un crédito de un millón cuarenta mil  colones
(¢1.40.000.00), Manuel depende  de esta actividad para sostener a su  familia, manifiesta que por medio  de este financiamiento saldrá  adelante económicamente.
texts.en: Manuel is a very entrepreneurial farmer with a great desire to excel. He raises corn and beans, which he needs to maintain using fungicides, insecticides, and fertilizers, and it is for the purchase of these supplies and seeds for these crops that he is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 colones. Manuel depends on this work to sustain his family. He states that through this financing he will be able to advance economically.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Inseparables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INSEPARABLES”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Primitiva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio, venta de juguetes, venta de jugos, venta de medicina natural, sombrerería, venta de regalos, tejido de busos

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Primitiva es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de sombreros; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió después de años de ser operario de su hermano, que tenía este negocio, posteriormente decide abrir su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de la Ciudad de Sucre y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la feria de la frontera Perú -Bolivia. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito y los consultorios.
texts.en:
The group Inseparables will begin their fifth cycle with Pro Mujer. As part of the focal point of Germán Busch, it is made up of 10 members and is directed by a board where Primitiva is the President. The members of the community association are involved in various businesses including: selling cosmetics, corner store, selling toys, selling juice, selling natural medicine, hat shop, selling gifts, making sweaters.

The loan will benefit small businesses, of which Primitiva is a member. She joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling hats; she tells us that she launched her business after years of working for her brother, who had the business, then afterwards decided to open her own workspace.
 
The loan is to increase capital (to buy leather) that she will acquire from Sucre and later, after she crafts them, she will sell the hats at the fair at the Peru-Bolivia border. This type of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health and credit training and the consulting offices.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is married with three children. She is 60 years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.

Florenda sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to to buy fishing materials for catching fish.

Florenda has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for catching fish

loans.name: Arceli's Group

texts.en:
Arceli is married with one child. She is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Arceli is a farmer, and grows assorted vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to finance land preparation. 

Arceli has been a member of PMPC for two years.  She is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of land preparation.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 46 years old, and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga.  She is single with no children
. 
To earn a living, Imelda has a business buying and selling bananas. She earns about PHP 2800 each month doing this type of work. Imelda has  requested a loan to purchase raw bananas.

Imelda has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase 500 kilos of bananas.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann, 47 years old, is married to a farmer and blessed with five children. They are currently residing in the village of La Paz. She manages a livestock business, particularly hog-raising, and she's been in this business for almost 15 years. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase hog feed for her hogs. From every hog that she sells, she gets a net income of PHP 7,000. Her income is spent on their daily expenditures and also on allowances for their children. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can able to repair the pig pens for her hogs.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed for her hogs

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 42 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elvie has a food business in the Philippines. Elvie requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables, meat, chicken and some ingredients.

Elvie has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken and some ingredients

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie is widow with 4 children. She is 48 years old and lives in Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga.

Debbie sells assorted groceries and beverages to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 4,900 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase additional stock to sell.

Debbie has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase 15 boxes of assorted groceries and beverages

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 38 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marilou has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 36 years old and married with two children.

Rosario works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Rosario has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rosario aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Visitacion's Group

texts.en:
Visitacion is 54 years old and lives in South Mapang, Rizal. She is married with six children. 

Visitacion has a shop that sells grocery items and electronic loads (pre-paid cell phone credits). She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to purchase new stock to sell.

Visitacion has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. She is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase ten boxes of groceries and electronic loads

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 38 years old, married, and has two children who are all in school. Susana works very hard to provide for them.

Susana runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Susana has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent, diapers, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yapuchiri 7 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YAPUCHIRI 7”  iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Matiasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: macramé de mantas, artesanía, venta de paraguas, venta de prendas de vestir, venta de chuño por mayor, venta de helado, venta de víveres, modista

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Matiasa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de macramé de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por enseñanza de su mamá a la cual ayudaba a trabajar, posteriormente decide establecer su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “YAPUCHIRI 7” will start its ninth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Germán Busch Regional Office. The group comprises eight members and is run by a board of directors with Matiasa as president. The businesses that the members run are varied and include making macramé blankets, crafts, selling umbrellas, selling clothes, selling chuño (dehydrated potatoes) wholesale, selling ice-cream, selling groceries, dressmaker.

The loan that they receive will benefit the small micro-businesswomen where Matiasa is a member. She explained that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. At present she has a business making macramé blankets. She says that she started when her mother taught her how, and she helped her mother with her work. Later she decided to set up her own business.

She will use the loan to increase capital (purchase wool), which she will get at the fair in the El Alto city. She will make the blankets and sell them to order.  This way of working enables her to generate resources to maintain her family, as she is married with a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training workshops on health and loans.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is 29 years old. She is married and resides with her mother and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been carrying meatball and papaya salad to sell in the local community for more than four years, earning approximately $8 daily. Her husband helps her run the business.

In order to improve her business, Chanda is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a tricycle vehicle to use in the business. This purchase will help her business run smoothly and faster. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle vehicle to use in the business

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA”  iniciará el vigésimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosenda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, venta de faldas, venta de chompas, salón de billar, venta de papa y chuño, venta de verduras, venta de busos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosenda es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió en el taller de su prima donde anteriormente trabajaba.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ciudades de Potosí, Cochabamba y Oruro. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The "Primavera" (Spring) communal bank will start its 25th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the association's Andes regional office. The group has eight members, and is led by a board of which Rosenda is the chairperson. The businesses carried out by the members of this communal bank are varied, and include the knitting of sweaters, the sale of skirts, the sale of sweaters, the running of a billiards room, the sale of potatoes and potato starch, the sale of vegetables, and the sale of sweatpants. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit these small business owners, including Rosenda. She says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer, and joined the association upon being invited to do so by a Pro Mujer representative who went to visit her in her home. She currently has a business knitting sweaters. She relies on this work, and learned her trade in a workshop run by her cousin, where she used to work.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital (to buy wool). She will acquire this wool from distribution companies, and will then sell the clothing she makes in the cities of Potosí, Cochabamba and Oruro. This way of working allows her to generate the resources she needs to provide for her household as best as possible, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rosenda said that she likes the health and savings areas.

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Winangun Sari Group

texts.en:
To increase their businesses, the Winangun Sari group continues to borrow loans from MUK with increasing loan sizes. They feel comfortable having the loan because they also have been trained by the MUK staff. 

After succeeding with the last loan, I Nengah is continuing to borrow a loan to purchase a sow and renovate the cage. Now the price for a sow is 1.5 million IDR. All the profits from this business will be saved. He hopes the business will grow and he will become a successful pig breeder and piglet seller.

loans.use: To purchase a sow and renovate the cage

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and has eight children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
Sotera is 54 years old and lives in D'BAN, Calamba. She is married with 4 children. 

To earn a living, Sotera has a business selling barbecue. She earns about PHP 1800 each month doing this type of work. Sotera has a requested a loan to purchase ingredients needed to make barbecue.

Sotera has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make Barbecue.

loans.name: Arcadio

texts.es: Arcadio, un humilde campesino  de  42 años de edad, originario de la Comarca llamada Cacao, en las afueras de Teustepe, casado, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 8 y 15 años, actualmente los 2 están  estudiando, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijoles  y tomate desde hace 15 años. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio  desde muy joven trabajando con su mama en la siembra. Hoy tiene  sus vaquitas y sus tierras donde trabaja las que ha ido comprando con las ganancias de sus cosechas, para realizar sus trabajos siempre paga mozo la cosecha siempre la lleva a vender a Managua donde pagan mejor el grano. En esta ocasión  Arcadio solicita este crédito para comprar dos vacas. Para venderlos a un mejor precio, ya que con  las ganancias que le genere al momento que las venda tendrá mejores ingresos para seguir invirtiendo en su cosecha.
texts.en:
Arcadio, a humble farmer of 42 years of age, from the Cacao area on the outskirts of Teustepe, is married and a father of 2 children between the ages of 8 and 15 years old. At present both of his children are studying. 

He works in agriculture, sowing maize, beans and tomatoes. He has been doing this for 15 years. He started doing this kind of work when he was very young, helping his mother with the sowing. Now he has cows and the land that he works he purchased with the money he earned from his crops. He hires labourers to carry out work. 

He always takes his harvest to sell in Managua, where they pay better prices for grain. On this occasion Arcadio is requesting the loan to buy two cows. He will sell them at a better price. He will use the earnings from the sale to improve his income, which he can then use to continue investing in his crop for harvest.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Poeurn

texts.en: Poeurn is 51 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 daily. Her husband is employed and earns about $4 each day. Two of her children are garment workers who make an income of $6 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Poeurn requests a loan of $500 to purchase cattle to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell

loans.name: Sharon Rose

texts.en:
Sharon Rose is 36 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sharon Rose is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Sharon Rose has been raising pigs for 10 years and earns additional income from frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
This is Merly, 58, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her children and they are managing their household as they operate the business. She also has a variety store for additional income. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their family.

Merly operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students who require her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume and office documentation; as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merly hopes that her business will keep on growing and dreams that her grandchildren will have a good education and a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia, 44 years old, is married to a government employee and blessed with three children. They are currently residing in the village of La Paz. She manages a livestock business raising hogs. She's been in this business for almost 22 years. With this business, she earns a net income of PHP 3,000 for every hog that she sells. She would like a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase some hogs to raise and hog feed. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can gain more income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise and hog feed

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Uuganbayar is 25 years old and lives with his wife in Darkhan which is the second largest city of Mongolia. The couple resides in their own house on a plot of land. His wife works as a hairdresser. He began working as a contract taxi driver at a private business entity in 2012. Before working as a taxi driver, he had been working as a truck driver for the mining industry. He uses his own automobile for his taxi service. The automobile has deteriorated over the past few years and is consuming a lot of petrol. He is requesting a loan of 3800000 MNT to purchase a new automobile which runs on natural gas. 

As a result, he can provide his taxi service for a sustainable period according to his contract with the private business entity.  More importantly, due to using natural gas as a fuel, the automobile he is purchasing will emit less smoke thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas

loans.name: Sam An

texts.en: Sam An is 40 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 daily. Her husband runs a public transportation service (tuk tuk taxi). He earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sam An is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase cattle to resell. By doing so, she would earn additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store from her home and also help her children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 45 years old and married with one child.

Meriam works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Meriam has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Meriam aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 65 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 6 children. 

Irene has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately 1,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase items such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar and oil.

Irene has been a member of PMPC for almost 9 years. In the future, Irene hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing items such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his secondary school studies.

loans.name: Lorilyn

texts.en:
Lorilyn is 30 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

Lorilyn has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Lorilyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

Lorilyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lorilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Francisca is engaged in rice palay trading and dried fish vending businesses and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stocks of dried fish and rice palay to sell. 
 
Francisca has been a member of PMPC for almost nine years. In the future, Francisca hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish and rice palay to sell

loans.name: Khurelkhuyag

texts.en: Mr. Khurelkhuyag is 47 years old and lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar which is the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been working as an engineer in the dismantling division of a construction business. From December to February, construction work stops which leaves him without a job. The company pays him a very small amount of money. His salary is the only source of family income because his wife is unemployed and stays at home. He has begun building a house with two flats. The new house is conjoined with the small house they live in. Due to a lack of finances, some interior decorations and the heating system isn’t completely finished. He is requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as gypsum, paint, nails and cement. He would also like to install the heating system. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place and burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and install a heating system

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 36-year-old married woman with six children, ages 17, 14, 12, 10, 8, and 6.  She lives with her family and husband in Mwambalazi, Mombasa, Kenya.  She works in her food stall where she sells fruits and vegetables.  She has been in this business for six years and that has given her sales experience to help earn a higher income.  Many customers prefer her because of the quality of food, the good prices, and her excellent customer service.  She is an active woman who is dedicated to her work and very eager to get ahead.  She is always looking for new opportunities that will bring her success.  Every day she works her hardest because she knows that is the only way she will achieve her dream.

She is requesting a 50,000 KSH loan to help expand her business by buying sacks of cabbages and oranges.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cabbages and oranges to resell.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like pants, slippers, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Merlie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is submitting Merlie's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pants, slippers, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is 49 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $2 daily. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Pov requests a loan of $750 to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it much stronger and more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is married and has five children, only two of her children go to school.  She buys and sells cattle.   She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cattle for resale.  She has been in this business for 5 years and sells at the market once a week but sells on wholesale only. Her major business challenges include transportation and lack of enough capital to boost her business. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation. She also hopes to pay school fees and to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Ma. Doria

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Doria works hard to support her family.  She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ma. Doria is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transportation business.

Ma. Doria has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Raul Diosdado

texts.en:
Raul Diosdado is 50 years old and has five children.  He is married and has two children who are in school.

Raul Diosdado is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  He requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for his pigs.

Raul Diosdado has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business.

In the future, Raul Diosdado would like to save money to expand his business and continue to send his children to college.

loans.use: buy medicines and vaccines for his pigs

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito is married and has 3 children.  He is 60 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Pedrito sells flowers to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for 14,900 Pesos to add capital on his flower vending business.

In the future, Pedrito hope to have more savings.

loans.use: purchase more stocks of flowers

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with no dependent. 

Maricel is engaged in a vegetable gardening activity and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing commercial fertilizers for her vegetable gardening activity. 

Maricel has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to grow vegetables

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a widow with 3 children.  She is 55 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Marilyn sells vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for 13 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. 

Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Marilyn hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is 59 years old, married and has eight children. 

Sergio is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.  He requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

Sergio has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sergio would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Jeanth Faith

texts.en:
Jeanth Faith is 20 years old and lives in Cabgan, Pta. Miray, Baliangao. She is married and has one child. 

Jeanth Faith works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for one and a half years. She has requested a loan to finance her fish selling business. 

Jeanth Faith has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years.

loans.use: finance her fish vending business

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Sokim is 35 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $4 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Sokim is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase timber and zinc to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: buy materials to build a new house

loans.name: Baasanjargal

texts.en: Mr. Baasanjargal is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Ger in Tosontsengel soum of Zavhan, Mongolia. He and his wife Uuganbayar, age 38, has been running a cobbler service business at home since 2006. His sons Myagmarjav, age 16, and Sugarhuu, age 14, and daughter Hongorzul, age 11, go to local schools. The youngest daughter Suglegmaa, age 4, goes to the local kindergarten. They have already built closer relationship with their customers and suppliers over the years. He is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase leather and other inventory for their cobbler business. Both the borrower and his wife are hardworking and positive people.

loans.use: to purchase leather and other inventory for his cobbler business.

loans.name: Emil

texts.ru:
Эмиль родился и живет  в селе Ужанис,Сюникской области.Он не женат и проживает вместе с отцом.
С ранних лет Эмиль занимается сельким хозяйством и скотоводством.С 2009 года он имеет собственную ферму в селе Ужанис . У него на ферме есть крупный рогатый скот, куры у свинья. А его отец помогает ему справлятся с огородом , где выращивают овощи и фрукты. У Эмиля еще есть земельный участок, где сеет только зерновые культуры. 
Круглый год Эмиль реализует в оптовых рынках Сюникской области мясо, молоко,сыр,яйца, овощи и фрукты. Труд конечно тяжелый но как Эмиль говорит ; иметь собственную ферму очень прибыльно. Он гордится тем что со своим тяжелым трудом может достойно содержать семью. 
Эмилю нужен кредит на сумму 300,000 Армянских драм для организации весенних посевных робот и для покупки семян ячменя.
texts.en:
Emil was born and lives in the village of Ujanis in the Syunik province of Armenia.  He is not married and lives with his father.

He has been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry since his youth.  In 2009 he got his own farm in the village of Ujanis.  He currently owns some cattle, chickens and pigs.  His father helps him to take care of the garden where they grow fruits and vegetables.  Emil also owns a parcel of land where he cultivates only grain crops.

Throughout the year, he sells meat, milk, cheese, eggs, fruits and vegetables at the wholesale markets of the Syunik province.  Emil works hard of course but, as he says, having his own farm is very profitable.  He takes pride in the fact that, thanks to his hard work, he is able to adequately provide for his family.

He needs a loan of 300,000 Armenian dram to get ready for the spring planting season and to buy barley seeds.

loans.use: to organize spring planting and buy barley seeds.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Presentacion works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. 

Presentacion is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Presentacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses is a twenty-five-year-old dryland farmer, husband, and father of one child. His wife is a farmer too. 

Moses does poultry farming, keeps cattle and grows food crops. Due to erratic rains, pests and diseases, and the difficulty of marketing his chickens, his agricultural endeavors prove challenging. 

Regarding the KOMAZA microforestry program, Moses says, "The KOMAZA program is good as it avails inputs and trains farmers in its projects. Being in a KOMAZA group gives [me] skills and [we] can share a lot as a group then improve [our] businesses." 

Moses intends to use the profits he receives from his tree farm to build a good house, feed his family better meals, and buy clothing. He also sees the KOMAZA program as a way to "ensure quality education" for his children.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his tree farm inputs (seedlings, fertilizer) and pay for technical training and maintenance

loans.name: Rodenia

texts.en:
Rodenia is married with 2 children.  She is 42 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rodenia is a farmer and owns a rubber and coconut farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more coconut and rubber for her farm.

Rodenia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rodenia hopes to expand her coconut and rubber farm.

loans.use: buy coconut and rubber for her farm

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 59 years old and lives in Birayan, Rizal. She is married and has 4 children. 

Regina has a copra and charcoal business and earns approximately PHP 4500 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repair. 

Regina has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: buy construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with 2 children.  To earn a living, Alicia has a business selling a variety of food. She earns about PHP 5000 each month doing this type of work. 

Alicia has requested a loan  to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.  Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, She would like to expand her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Baatardalai

texts.en:
Baatardalai is a 52-year-old widower who lives with his 2 children in a ger in Har-Horin Soum of Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His daughter (Nomin-Erdene, age 28) works at a local school as a teacher, and his son (Suhbold, age 25) is a university student. 

Baatardalai has been running an auto repair business on his plot of land since 2001. He has stopped his business because his welding machine has broken and he is not able to provide his service to customers. He needs to repair or replace his equipment to restart his business. He is now requesting 1,300,000MNT to purchase better machinery to re-provide his business to his customers. 

Baatardalai is hardworking, diligent and positive person.

loans.use: buy machinery for his auto repair business

loans.name: Renelfa

texts.en:
Renelfa is married and has 5 children.  She is 39 years old and lives in Pta. Miray, Baliangao.

Renelfa sells grocery items and beverages to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 2700 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5000 PHP to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Renelfa has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Domero

texts.en:
Domero is 57 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has 2 children. 

Domero is engaged in copra buying business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in paying the tuition fee for his daughter. 

Domero has been a member of PMPC almost 2 years. In the future, Domero hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: pay tuition fee for his daughter

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

Cherry successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  NWTF is relisting Cherry's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy fruits to sell

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella aprendió el oficio de la costurería desde hace quince años; fue su mamá quien le enseño. Los insumos para costurar, los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a veinticinco kilómetros de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tela para la elaboración de uniformes escolares. De esta manera, satisfacera la demanda de uniformes que tiene y podrá recibir ingresos económicos que le permitan mejorar su condición económica y la de su familia. Su deseo es poseer una sastrería de alto nivel y realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old, married, and has two children. She learned the sewing trade 15 years ago; it was her mother who taught her. She gets her sewing supplies in a city that is located 25 km from her home. 

The loan that she is requesting is to buy fabric tor making school uniforms so that she will be able to satisfy her current demand. Also, she will be able to receive income which will allow her to improve her and her family's financial situation. Her wish is to own to a high-quality tailor's shop and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making school uniforms.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is married with two children. She is 39 years old and lives in Binuangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Liza sells dried fish and longaniza to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more dried fish and longaniza to earn a living.

Liza has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish and longaniza to earn a living

loans.name: Sanatan

texts.en:
Sanatan is a resident of a small village, Baunsiapada, in Nayagarh district, Odisha. He is 27 years old and staying with his parents, his wife and a child. He has been supporting his family through the income earned from a small grocery store. He sells food items like snacks, spices, electric bulbs, pickles, onions, tea leaves and potatoes in his village. He has had a shop for the last four years. 

He needs a loan of 35,000 INR in order to buy snacks, spices, rice, wheat flour and other household necessities like toilet cleaners, mosquito repellents and wafers for his shop. He says there is good demand for mosquito repellents and sanitizers as mosquito-borne diseases are very widely prevalent in his village. He wants to increase his income and provide his family better facilities of life and save some money for his family's future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing snacks, spices, rice, wheat flour and other household necessities like toilet cleaners and mosquito repellents for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with 10 children. She is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosita is a farmer and grows assorted crops such as banana, coconut, etc to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to finance her coconut plantation. She has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to finance her coconut plantation.

loans.name: Illampu Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ILLAMPU”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, producción de alfombras, costura de polleras, costura de ropa de moreno, venta de frutas, venta de queso, tejido de mantas, venta de comida, tejido de lana de  alpaca, confección de deportivos, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  costura de polleras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de un trabajo anterior que tuvo en el taller de su cuñada, posteriormente decide abrir su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ILLAMPU" will begin their fourth loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Pan-American regional office. It is comprised of 11 members and is led by a board of directors with Martha serving as the President. The members carry out a variety of business activities, including selling sweaters, rug making, sewing traditional Andean skirts, sewing indigenous clothing, selling fruit, selling cheese, blanket knitting, food sales, alpaca wool knitting, making sportswear, and running a neighborhood store. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit these small business owners such as the member Martha. She points out that this is the fourth loan cycle that she is a part of with Pro Mujer. She joined by an invitation from her neighbor who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a small business of sewing traditional Andean skirts. She tells us that she learned this trade from a previous job that she had in her sister-in-law's workshop. Afterwards, she decided to open up her own work space. 

The loan that she will presently take out is to increase capital. She will buy fabric from fairs in the city of La Paz, and then she will sells what she makes with it by order. This form of employment allows her to generate resources to maintain her home the best way possible since she is a widow and has three children.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Ay

texts.en:
Ay is 51 years old. He is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction worker for more than six years, earning approximately $2 daily. His wife is a rice farmer who makes an income of $2 each day. Three of their children are employed. They earn about $9 per day. Due to the lack of funds, Ay is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and toilet. This money will help him provide hygienic living conditions for the family.
